review_text: We stayed in a family loft which is two connecting rooms, one with a king and one with 2 doubles. Each has a bathroom. So perfect for our family of 5! The hotel and our room is very clean. The beds are so comfortable.  The front desk staff is amazing and provides us as much bottled water as we need. The supervisor Kima made sure we were comfortable and gave us an early check in which was so appreciated. The location is great, very easy to get anywhere we want. I would definitely stay here again!

review_text: I don't usually write reviews, but because of the amazing hospitality we experienced at the Innside NY, a review is definitely warranted! We've stayed at the Innside NY many times and have always had a good experience. On this visit we came to NY due to an emergency. The staff at the Innside NY was so helpful, understanding, empathetic and accommodating, they made our very difficult emergency situation much easier. Zack, Maggie, Cassie, Alexander and Akhlima were all absolutely fabulous! Each of them went above and beyond so that we were able to focus on our emergency situation and not worry about the logistics of our stay. Zack even loaned us his own personal phone charger for the evening. Seeing first hand how caring and hospitable the staff has been at the Innside, I would  not hesitate to recommend the Innside NY, and it will always be our first choice of where to stay when we come to Manhattan.â€¦

review_text: On arrival we had major issues with our booking - hotel insisted that we didnâ€™t have one which was not a fun experience having just arrived from Ireland and an exceptionally long trip due to covid testing requirements before we left home and unfortunately found the duty manager that day to initially be quite dismissive of our dilemma. But very pleased to say the issue was eventually resolved and we found the hotel to be very central, within easy walking distance of Times Square. The room was clean, beds very comfortable, had a mini fridge and safe and I would have no hesitation in recommending - just make sure to bring proof of your booking with you!!

review_text: The hotel was in a great location! Rooms are rather small but just what you need for somewhere to sleep and have a shower. I would recommend ensuring you have your booking confirmation printed as we had booked two rooms and only one room was showing on the system when we arrived at the reception. Fortunately, the confirmation showed that two had been booked and paid for. Also, donâ€™t expect to receive your incidental deposit back in a hurry. We departed on 7th December and have still not received the money back for both rooms. We have tried to contact the hotel (email and  phone) but have still received no reply.

Overall a very nice hotel, a great location and the staff are very helpful so all good in that respect.  Our main issue is the hotels policy on generating income as they seem to give priority to anyone that hires their function rooms over their guests.  After a meal in Greenwich village we decided to go back to the hotel for drinks rather than walking around looking for places to go as it was cold and raining.  Other than the reception area the only place hotel guests can go (other than their room) is the restaurant/function room. review_text: Glad I payed a little extra to stay here.  Room was very modern and contemporary and clean.  Felt room was spacious for NY City hotel room.  Subway entrance just a street up and Penn Station and MSG just a short walking distance so location was perfect for our needs.  We didn't actually go to the restaurant and bar but it seemed to be a very happening place.  When open it always seemed busy and they even had a DJ in lobby playing music.  I wouldn't hesitate staying here again on a return trip to NYC.

review_text: Hotel and room were very clean upon arrival. Good location, with subway right around the corner.   Butâ€¦ we stayed for 3 nights and received no housekeeping during our stay! Hair dryer was broken. There was no mention in our confirmation email or at check-in that you had to request a Nespresso machine for your room, something that is included in the daily additional $35 facility fee.  Also, I paid extra for a city view room, (which their website describe as skyline views, including the Freedom Tower) and I was on the 9th floor (of 20), looking into office windows across the street. No skyline view at all! And be prepared for the tiniest bathroom I have ever had, including in Europe.  An OK place, but room for better communication and oversight.

review_text: This is my go-to hotel for business and personal travel.  The hotel staff are very welcoming and the front desk is managed by Alex Martinez - he is the reason I return time and time again!  You are always greeted like a long lost friend, check-in is efficient and always a wonderful experience!  The rooms are well equipped, beds are very comfortable, clean and have all the amenities needed. Have an event - then Alexandria Castro is your go to person! She is efficient, detail oriented and has always come through even with last minute requests.

review_text: I visited NY CITY this time with my parents (in their 60s) , and it was their first time. In the past, I've stayed with friends, so this was my first NY city hotel experience. The hotel was above our expectations. We had no issues, and the staff was great. We felt safe since the elevator  requires a room card to use it. The restaurant has a great ambience, so I was glad no visitor can use the elevator. We are planning to return next year since we have a few things we did not get to do, and my father said: 'we have to come back to the same hotel'.

review_text: Our stay was absolutely amazing. My mom, future mother in law and I stayed at the Innside Nomad in Manhattan because we came to the city to wedding dress shop for myself. The hotel and staff we both wonderful. I loved the atmosphere of the hotel, bar and restaurant so much! I would most definitely stay here again. For a 3 night stay for 3 people and breakfast included, the rates we extremely reasonable. I was so happy to not have to spend a fortune on lodging as we would be doing other activities in the city as well. More than happy to give glowing reviews of this hotel!

review_text: I highly. recommend INNside New York NoMad, it is perfectly located, clean, with friendly and helpful staff. The front desk held my luggage until my room was ready. I had a balcony room and it was worth the money.  My room was clean and I opted for daily housecleaning. Due to covid, you may have to ask for certain amenities, like slippers, robes, blow-dryer, iron + ironing board, etc. My room had a small fridge which was perfect to store beverages in. Also, you can request complimentary water bottles, which is a plus. I enjoyed the Nespresso coffee maker in the room; the coffee mugs were cute too. The rainfall shower was very nice, but if you don't want to get your hair wet, you don't have to use the rainfall shower. They have liquid soap and 2-in-1 shampoo/conditioner. I didn'tâ€¦

review_text: Love the hotel location. It is situated right in the center of Chelsea. Easy access to The High Line, Flowers Market, Chelsea Flea Market, FIT and other art stores. Short walk to lovely Maman Cafe.  The hotel itself is one of the very rare which can provide guests a good night sleep. Not noisy or smell of Marijuana in the hallway like other hotels in Soho. The front desk attendees are super nice and accommodating. Will definitely come back and recommend to friends.

review_text: My teenage daughter and I recently took a "girls trip" to NYC. We took the Acela into NYC and the Innside was about a 10 minute walk and very easy to find. We arrived around 11:30 AM and asked to have our baggage stored but the hotel was able to check us in early which was really nice!   The hotel lobby is small and has some seating but it is very clean and there is an outside lounge area which was highly utilized and very comfortable.   Our room was on the 16th floor and faced the front of the building. There wasn't a spectacular view - if you are looking for a view you may want a higher floor or possibly the other side of the building may provide one.   The room and bathroom aren't huge (which we didn't expect as it is a city hotel) but provided plenty of storage, a smallâ€¦

review_text: First time to New York, hotel was a nice surprise. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was beautiful with an amazing view! Ask for the 20th floor - worth the small upgrade fee! Water towers and Freedom tower - so breathtaking. Restaurant was nice with good food. Saturday night they had a DJ in the lobby and it was fun to walk through and see all the activity in the restaurant/bar and outdoor seating areas. Very clean, very safe - great vibe! Would stay here again and have already recommended to my friends!

review_text: From the minute we walked in to the minute we left the service was FABULOUS! Very attentive especially the night employees at the front desk and housekeeping! We feel terrible because we had minutes to get to our train and forgot to leave a tip for the hard workers that cleaned our rooms. We will be staying there again when we come back so will be making up for it! The gym was great they even had a skipping rope which I have never seen before so I was very happy. No towels though which was a huge bummer. The tv was very spotty but it was not that big of deal seeing as we didn't spend a lot of time in the room even with our 6 year old. The room was very quiet too. Thank you Melia for making our first trip to New York special and stress free!!!

review_text: This was my third stay at this hotel--this time I got it as part of a JetBlue package deal and it was well worth the price of $135 a night--you can't beat that for a hotel this nice in Manhattan. I walk everywhere when I'm in the city, and the location of the Innside is perfect for that. I would highly recommend this hotel for the single traveller or a couple looking for a getaway weekend in Manhattan.

review_text: We celebrated my Bachelorette in New York during Labour day weekend. We were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. We stayed in the Family Loft which were two adjoining rooms, each with a bathroom.  It was more spacious than we anticipated so we would definitely recommend this type of room for groups again. The rooms were clean and decor minimal but still a modern feel. Overall, the staff were friendly and we had a good experience from check-in to check-out. We would stay here again!

review_text: My friends & I had a great stay at Innside NYC. The hotel was super modern, clean & in close proximity to a ton of cool restaurants & bars. Our check in with Kimberly was seamless (much appreciated after a long ride from Boston). The view from our room on the 19th floor was amazing. The room could have been a tad bigger for the price, but the style & design more than made up for that. The Wilson (restaurant w/in the hotel) was great. The outdoor seating area in the back was gorgeous. Our server Esteban was excellent. Only complaint-kitchen closed @9:30â€¦ I thought this was the city that never sleeps? Check out was also great (minus the â€œresort feesâ€). Alex , Ridge & Christina were very kind & more than happy to store our 15 bags while we spent some time enjoying the city afterâ€¦

review_text: Great hotel for the price. The rooms and facilities were exceptionally clean, quiet and comfortable. Traveling during the pandemic we felt safe staying at this hotel. The only drawback is that the Wilson isn't open for breakfast so we had to walk a few blocks to find a place to eat in the morning.

review_text: I had a really great experience at the Innside hotel. My check-in was quick, the staff was super friendly. The hotel was nice, my room was pretty roomy for NY standards. The air conditioning was adequate. The room has a little mini fridge, which was nice. Everything was clean. The lobby smells amazing- like flowers or something. The restaurant adjacent was delicious, I ate a couple of meals there. Fun little rose garden area in the back too. I would stay here again for sure.

review_text: Had a great stay at the Innside New York NoMad. The front desk staff, especially Alex, Christina, Kit and Ridge, were wonderful. They were very professional and accommodated my requests and provided helpful advice on places to go and where to have meals. The room that I was assigned was fantastic. It was very clean, comfortable and had a great city view of the Freedom Tower. I would definitely stay at this hotel on my next stay in NYC!

review_text: Very expensive for the tiniest room and smallest bathroom possible. Also, the strong lotion in the lobby is not good for people with allergies/smell sensitivities. We requested more towels for the room and it took over an hour to get them. We left after the first night because we werenâ€™t happy with our stay and service. Two different people gave us different explanations of their cancellation policy, even when the reason we were leaving was the bad customer service and terrible room. Finally the manager spoke with us and said that we would only be charged for the one night we stayed and no other fees would be charged. I just saw my credit card bill with charges and I was definitely charged more than the one night stay. Very dissatisfied with my experience staying in this hotel.

review_text: Our stay was great considering my wife had to look after a 3.5 year old daughter and 3 month son for whom it was the first overnight stay outside of our house. There is a lot that the place offers like bikes to go around city but we could not use it. Maybe next time when it is just me and my Wife. my only gripe would be the 35 $ fee which was a little excessive considering all facilities could not be used and it included wifi use . Being a Melia Rewards Gold member I would have hoped that such fees are reduced for Gold and Platinum at the very least.

review_text: Excellent location (mid-town & close to subway station and restaurants). Very clean room. Quiet on the 16th floor. Bed was very comfortable. Reasonably sized room for NYC. Biggest issue was hotel restaurant. It was not open every day and did not serve breakfast (although it was advertised as doing so several places on-line). Restaurant menu was also odd, with several esoteric dishes at the expense of more "standard" fare. We mostly ate or drank somewhere else in our 7-day stay. Luckily, for breakfast, Friedman's is a short walk away and is excellent.

review_text: Our stay at Melia Innside NOMAD was a mixed bag. The amenities, cleanliness, ambiance and location were all tiptop. The outdoor patio downstairs was a nice place to hang out and have a drink and the location is well positioned near metros and various sights, even the hotel restaurant, "The Wilson" was surprisingly nice, and quite busy to boot. BUT WE WERE GIVEN A ROOM WE DID NOT BOOK. We paid extra for a "CITY VIEW" room and expected to either see the financial district  downtown or of the Empire State building and etc uptown. WE SAW NEITHER.   BEWARE, UNLESS YOU ARE ON FLOORS 18-20, YOUR VIEW WILL BE OF THE SURROUNDING BUILDINGS. The picture of the "City View" room online is taken from one of those top three floors, we were on floor 13 and had a "view" of the building acrossâ€¦

review_text: We just recently spent a weekend at INNSiDE when I took my daughter and her soon-to- be maid of honor to NYC to dress shop! The INNSIDE staff was so accommodating, responsive, and professional. The area felt safe and was within walking distance to everything we wanted! Everything from start to finish went smooth.  The rooms were meticulously clean and the bed was so comfortable! Having The Wilson restaurant there was so convenient and their staff went above and beyond also.  I would definitely stay there again.

review_text: After a career in HR, this hotel has it down for hiring great staff and fabulous customer service.  Every staff member was friendly and helpful - - and really went above and beyond with all our requests.  Whitney & Christina rocked the front desk! I traveled from Oregon to meet family and spend two days in the City (including an appt at Kleinfelds). The location was great, easy walk to Kleinfelds and Madison Ave park (with Shake Shack), subway is close.  It was an easy walk from the new train station (wow! Penn station what a change!).  Room was small compared to Oregon hotels, but had everything we needed.  Beds were comfortable, linens were fine. Views were stunning on floor 19.  The Resturant "The Wilson" had a great happy hour. Covid wise, mask still required and manyâ€¦

review_text: We came to visit our family and stayed at the Innside hotel for 8 days. We didn't know what to expect, and we were very pleased to find a place to which we certainly will come back. In one word: excellent!! It starts with its great location, in the Chelsea area. It continues when you discover you arrived at a new hotel with spacious rooms relative to what is acceptable in Manhattan.  More than anything, it is important to note the good spirit, the kind and dedicated staff (Alex, Kit and Christina whom we have met more than once) make a difference.  In summary a hotel where the corridors are quiet and clean and, in the lobby, and restaurant next door you will always find young people that create a great atmosphere.

review_text: We stayed at Innside NY Nomad for a little over a week. From the beginning til the end of our stay, we were delighted by our experience and stay at the hotel. We appreciate that Christina and Alex went above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable and memorable by offering us great restaurant and activity recommendations. Our check-in experience was flawless, the rooms were clean and well-designed, the location was central, and the gym on the 20th floor was fantastic. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an enjoyable stay in NYC!

review_text: Visited New York for first half of honeymoon and enjoyed our stay at INNside. Rooms were clean and quiet with a modern and hip vibe. Location is actually really convenient if you're trying to go to Times Square, Highline, Chelsea Market, Or Flatiron. It actually wasn't even that tough of a walk to NoHo. There are plenty of markets close by for any items you may need.  Hotel staff was excellent and very receptive and responsive especially Ridge, Kit and Whitney. They were always very welcoming, very nice and always seemed to have energy!  Thanks you three and the rest of the INNside staff for a wonderful stay!

review_text: I appreciated the great views from the bed and how well located this is. However, considering the times and lack of tourism, you would expect for the staff to be friendly. The staff was very cold, not friendly, and made it seem like dealing with a guest had to be completed in 60 seconds or less. No hellos, no good mornings, no good evenings, no recommendations, nothing.   The rooms were comfortable, but small as is expected in NYC. The shower and sheets were the only places we didn't think were super clean, there was three broken tiles in the shower with dirty grout, dust/dirt in the corners, etc. A few random hairs on sheets/pillows at check-in. The floor, windows, etc seemed clean otherwise.   The views are great, the area is safe. If you're chill and don't need much, this isâ€¦

review_text: One of my favorite hotels in NYC.  This was my 2nd stay here (yes, it was that good) !  Great location close to subways, good restaurants and bars.  The rooms are gorgeous and spacious with great views. The hotel has a hip sexy vibe and has a beautiful restaurant/bar downstairs and an outdoor patio and lounge - and an interior courtyard with beautiful decor. The gym has a fantastic view and is kept very clean.   Huge shoutout to Richard H (Manager) for the upgrade and the great service from the team. Everyone at this hotel is helpful, professional, and very generous with their time and info.   I can't wait to come back!

review_text: I am so thankful to Trip Advisor for helping me find this hidden gem of a hotel in New York.  The reviews here are 100% accurate.  The Nomad is a beautiful hotel located in the flower district just a very short walk to Penn Station.  The hotel is impeccably clean.  It feels cleaner than a hospital and one has no doubt that they take cleanliness very seriously.  The hotel is also very secure with security always present in the lobby and needing your key to access the elevator.  The rooms themselves are very modern and large with lots of space to store your things.  I stayed in a king room alone but this room could easily accommodate a couple for a week long trip or more.  The bed is also very comfortable.  And the room is very bright with floor to ceiling windows.  However, whatâ€¦

review_text: WOW! If you are looking for a hotel for your vacation to NY, look no further!!!! This was the BEST HOTEL EXPERIENCE I have ever had (and I have worked at hotels and travel a lot so I know what customer service entails), and Innside NoMad exceeded every expectation! My boyfriend and I stayed one night for our anniversary, and it was definitely a night to remember! The excellent customer service began even before my arrival. I called ahead of time to confirm my reservation, and was greeted by the amazing manager, ALEX, who answered all of my questions and concerns, and he even said he would be expecting us the day we arrived. When we arrived, we were greeted and checked in by the wonderful, WHITNEY! Alex also came out to greet us as he said he would, so they really made us feel soâ€¦

review_text: I stayed at the Innside back in 2019, and I remember having such a wonderful experience. So, when I recently booked my stay (3/20/21) at Innside I wondered if my previous experience was going to be the same this time around. From the second I walked into the hotel,  I was greeted by Whitney and she could not have been more professional and welcoming. She made me feel just like I did when visited almost two years ago. I will be returning to Innside next month, so I am looking forward to my stay and seeing Whitney and the rest of the staff (and eating at Wilson's).  Sean C.

review_text: I first came to Innside for my birthday at the end of last year. Ever since my first stay, I have been back to Innside almost every month for business purposes. I love this place so much! The excellent customer service from Alex, Whitney, and the rest of the staff downstairs has been instrumental in why I've come back. I could choose to stay anywhere but I choose Innside because of the extraordinary experience here. Alex in particular goes above and beyond to make sure all my needs are taken care of.  From extra card keys, using the gym upstairs or suggesting places to go or see, I'm very appreciative for his upbeat attitude to genuine nature. It's so difficult to find hotels with exemplary customer service but I have never felt that while staying here. That is so important toâ€¦

review_text: Innside recently had a deal for Valentine's Day with The Wilson (the restaurant right in front of the hotel/on the same property) so boo and I took advantage! I'm glad we did!   It was a busy check-in (everyone was boo'd up for the night!) but hotel staff kept things going smoothly. Despite the busy/hectic evening, Alex was super sweet when checking us in and getting us situated. Also, because I was in the lobby for a while I observed the security guard doing a great job of keeping strays from getting too far into the hotel. It was really busy so that was quite impressive!    Our room had a city view, which was gorgeous. The bed was king-sized and the mattress comfortable (not too hard, not too soft!) so we got a good night's sleep! I also really liked the complimentaryâ€¦

review_text: This is by far the best hotel I've stayed at in NYC and believe me I've stayed at tons of them. The townhouse suite with balcony was just perfect size and luxurious, even better in person than the photos I seen before booking. Their staff though went above and beyond to assure me and my parties stay was just perfect. Alex at the front desk was a pleasure to deal with but, Whitney Najee, the manager was such a sweetheart and went above and beyond to make sure our stay was a very memorable one. We will for sure be back here in the near future. Solid booking if I might say, even the Wilson there resturaunt was impeccable. Loved everything about the choice I made to stay here.

review_text: My entire stay from beginning to end on New Year's Eve was exceptional! From check in to check out with Whitney who was attentive and very friendly. Shandana, the security officer was also very helpful and provided directions. My cousin and I had dinner at The Wilson Restaurant where Nancy greeted us and made sure that we were seated. Glenn made our dining experience more than we could have imagined. He too was attentive and had a sense of humor that was so memorable that we will be back soon. Our meal of choice was the Seafood Risotto that was absolutely delicious! Hats off to the chef. We ended our night laughing and having fun with my friend before retiring with warm showers. We slept ever so comfortably in our beds. Thank you to the Innside New York Nomad and The Wilsonâ€¦

review_text: The rooms have a great vibe and efficient layout. We were on the 17th floor, and had a great view of the city. There are several cool outdoor lounging areas which is great for pandemic safety. We were able to get takeout and eat it in an outdoor lounge. Overall, we loved it and would absolutely stay again if the price is right. The lobby & areas are fun spaces, the elevator has interesting decor, it's just so clean and lovely, and we got a good deal. The only thing I didn't appreciate was that they add a "resort fee" which is apparently for coffee & gym? The coffee you have to request, and due to covid, you have to schedule a slot at the gym. Which was great, it's just a really odd thing to add a "resort fee" for things that are completely standard offerings.

review_text: I stayed at the INNSIDE New York Nomad for a birthday staycation. My experience was truly wonderful. I was greeted immediately at the front desk and the staff there was warm and friendly-thanks Rob. My room was spacious and well appointed and the view was amazing. As it was my birthday, the Director of Sales left a nice little surprise for me-thanks Alexandra. Overall the hotel was extremely clean with several COVID-19 measures in place, regular cleaning, sanitizing stations, temperature checks, and my room itself along with the towels, remotes, phones, etc had been sanitized and sealed prior to my arrival, which made me feel completely at ease. The Wilson was open for business with their outdoor patio set up and I definitely took advantage of that with to glorious meals. Iâ€¦

As it was my birthday, the Director of Sales left a nice little surprise for me-thanks Alexandra. Overall the hotel was extremely clean with several COVID-19 measures in place, regular cleaning, sanitizing stations, temperature checks, and my room itself along with the towels, remotes, phones, etc had been sanitized and sealed prior to my arrival, which made me feel completely at ease. The Wilson was open for business with their outdoor patio set up and I definitely took advantage of that with to glorious meals. Iâ€¦

review_text: I was here for one night from oct 30th to check out on the 31st. I was greeted as soon as I entered the lobby, I was very impressed by the hotels boutique privacy look. Every detail is truly inspired by the most modern look of fashion, hence why itâ€™s the fashion district. Robert Hughes was very kind and professional, he answered all my concerns in regards to cleanliness due to covid situation. He was there for all of my request and made me feel right at home. The entire staff from the front desk to the house keeping are extremely attentive, I have the impression Robert is a senior manager; he is doing a fantastic job with them!. I will come back to this hotel and not look anywhere else. Thank you thank you thank you!

review_text: So, I was supposed to get married on a private rooftop in Chelsea, but it rained heavily that entire day.  From the moment that I checked in, the Director of Rooms, Robert Hughes came to the rescue! I was clearly upset about the rain, but he put me at ease. He upgraded my room, and made sure I was all set with the accommodations. I noticed that there was an indoor/outdoor garden attached to the lobby, and inquired about possibly using it for my ceremony instead. To my surprise, Robert advised that I was able to use the garden with no problem! I was so thankful, because I did not have a plan B for the outdoor wedding. In short, the ceremony was absolutely exquisite! The garden lights, the sound of the rain - everything was just perfect. Hotel employees Angel, Jose and Alex allâ€¦

Asked to see if it was ok to do an early check in and they told me not at the moment until 13:00. We dropped our luggage and tour the city. Came back to the hotel at 14:20 and the room wasnâ€™t ready. Front desk told me to wait 40 minutes. We sat outside and waited patiently. After 40 minutes passed, went back in and my room was still not ready. 15:00 they were so many people it was impossible to stayed inside the lobby. This time it was almost 16:00 and their excuse was that they didnâ€™t have enough housekeeping and mentioned that the front desk manager was helping housekeeping with the cleaning. Weâ€¦

review_text: Came to NY and stayed here for a weekend back in December with friends. My four friends and I were supposed to have two connecting rooms, but unfortunately, we got stuck with two rooms down the hall from one another. This was not a problem for us, but the hotel was very apologetic and even sent us a complimentary bottle of wine and chocolate. Very nice touch. The rooms here are small (to be expected in NY), but they are very clean and well kept.   What made this hotel ideal for us was its location. It was perfect walking distance from everything we needed to get to. We had a great stay here and we would definitely stay here again.

review_text: During my last overseas trip I extended my layover so that I could spend a full 24hours exploring the city. The Innside Hotel was perfectly positioned for my trip for easy exploration of the City. The hotel was modern and very well designed. The room was great, very clean.   I stopped into the gym in the morning, clean and amazing views!   To top it off the front desk staff was so accommodating, helpful and friendly. Especially Kit, he assisted with recommendations for exploring as well.   I highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

review_text: Found $200 of Hidden charges on my credit card after the stay. Booked through Hotels.com and paid in full in advance. Found a $200 charge on my credit card after the stay. Called the hotel to inquire and was told it was a $35 a night service fee for the so called 'complimentary' mini bar and gym access.  Wasn't made clear there would be the charge on hotels.com and wasn't told at check in or check out. Only found out later. Complete hidden charge rip off. Avoid

review_text: The hotel and the rooms have a nice, modern and clean look. Comfy beds. The hotel is in walking distance for a lot of the things to see in New York. And it's not far from subway stations to take you all over town. We were surprised about the service charge that we learned about when checking in. Adding the service charge to the room price, increased the cost quite a lot - making the price/value compared to other hotels different. Going to New York another time I would read the fine print, and probably stay at another hotel.

review_text: The staff at the MÃ©lia is what sets this hotel apart. The rooms are nice enough (clean enough/no bugs, comfy bed, spacious) and the location is excellent for getting other places (Flatiron isn't the best place just to hang out), but the staff itself was very helpful. From helping me seamlessly extend my stay, to dealing with another guests detailed requests in another language, to making sure the gym was stocked with Lysol wipes during the Coronavirus panic, the service was above and beyond. Shout out to Javier, Christina and Nalini at the front desk/lobby!

review_text: Booked here for a 5 day trip in NYC and the location was fantastic, only 10 minute walk from Empire State Building and great access to the Metro to all the sites. Hotel has a great vibe and lovely decor. Bedrooms and bathrooms well equipped and great size considering it's a city hotel! Would highly recommend to anyone. Staff were very welcoming and helped with all our needs. There is a gym there and has the best views of the NYC skyline.

review_text: This place has a lot of good things going for it. Rooms and beds are very nice. Bathrooms are nice. The front desk is professional and the overall hotel is clean and nice. The gym is small but decent and I was able to get a solid workout.  The cons: The worst - and I'm not being hyperbolic - worst room service I have ever experienced. Cold, small, extremely overpriced and served in a cheap paper bag. I've had better room service a the Days Inn in the middle of nowhere. Borderline criminal what they charge for this poor service. Also there is a $40 daily charge for the fridge contents- but there's nothing but cheap soda and one carton of water. Pretty sad.  Also TV/Movie choices are almost obsolete and well below par of hotels these days

review_text: My wife and I had a great time and a great value for NYC. Melissa at the front desk made our check in process easy and added some extras. I was very pleased to get a heads up that there is a mandatory $40/night facility charge when checking in instead of like other hotels finding out hidden in the bills at check out. She was very courteous and accommodating. The bar was good, but I cannot recommend the breakfast buffet for $28. The box water in the room is also hard to drink with a weird after taste. Overall we had a great time and will be staying here again!

review_text: The hotel itself was quite nice and good value for the price we paid.  The rooms are basic but comfortable.  The bathroom was tiny and as others have commented there was no room to put anything.  All of that would have been fine but the room was not cleaned properly when we arrived and got worse throughout the stay plus the amenities were not replaced consistently each day.   It actually felt quite dirty by the time we checked out.  For this reason I would not recommend this hotel.

review_text: Not a bad hotel, terrific location. But be prepared to pay an additional $40+ PER DAY fee they charge when you check out. They explained to me that it covers the mini fridge, the Wi-Fi, and access to the gym. None of which I really cared about. On top of that, we got no maid service on one day. They never came to the room at all during the day. Comfortable hotel, but they are absolutely gouging with that daily fee. Be prepared to pay it.  The rate might look great online, but make sure you add that amount per day. They donâ€™t advertise that. They surprise you with it when you get there. Otherwise, not a bad place.

review_text: I am a Melia member and love the chain, but our stay at this location was very disappointing. We had one of the Townhouse Suites on the 20th floor (room 2006). The suite's design was so off, that I was very surprised as I know that Melia prides itself with being modern and designed well while being very functional. It felt like they tried to furnish a suite with exactly the pieces of furniture that go into a single room, hence it felt empty. There was nothing on the walls either (including no hooks for towels in the bathroom), not a single picture. The A/C was so loud and constantly running that we had to shut it off all together. When we took a shower, the bathroom floor was flooded. Also, you entered the suite into what could be described as a living space. From that room, youâ€¦

review_text: I travel monthly back to NYC and return to this property time and time again.  Although you might not think of the Brand for business travel - the rooms are spacious, efficient, modern, and well appointed - room to work, spacious bathrooms and the staff is beyond accommodating.  Hugo is the Guest Services Manager who makes it his business to ensure his guests are welcomed, valued, and surprised with small but meaningful "VIP" gestures.  Its a great choice regardless of purpose.

review_text: Had a fabulous Valentines weekend at the INNside by Melia in NY.  Friendly staff and very hip hotel in the heart of Chelsea.   Location was perfect to walk too 5th avenue, Chelsea Market and the High Line.  Loved the restaurant The Wilson and our friendly bartender Neema. Food was great and so was the wine!  This hotel would be a great consideration for a small NYC meeting at a very reasonable price point.  I highly suggest and will return again soon.  And thank you Alexandra! :)

review_text: This hotel was recommended to us as being in a good location close enough to Times Square but far enough away at the same time and also having all the necessary facilities. And it did. Our bedroom was well enough equipped and not noisy. Wifi worked well throughout the hotel including the bedroom. The shower in the bathroom worked well too. Space in the bathroom was pretty tight. The hotel has a bar diner called Wilsons which is leased out and is very popular but pricey. Front of house staff were excellent as indeed were all of them. Not a huge choice of eating establishments in the area. We were happy enough with the offering but taxes fairly bumped the price of a stay up.

Our room was clean, modern, and smelled good. No odors being masked my chemical sprays. Not a large room, but that would have been unnecessary for our purpose. The bathroom was clean and the walk in shower provided two shower heads. Also included was body wash, shampoo, and conditioner. We didnâ€™t utilize room service or any eatery establishments in the hotel. We would recommended and use again.

review_text: We stayed in the Double Queen room facing the street. Pros: Room was quiet, clean, beds comfortable, and everything worked. Cons: Room was small, not enough hooks in the bathroom to hang towels, beverage center was useless bc you could only make one size coffee since only the smaller espresso cup could fit under the spout. These are small "cons," but after a few days, they would become annoying. The major negative at this place is the $40 daily service fee. They tell you this will cover all the juice, tea and coffee you would like.  However, they only carry one type of tea and coffee, so if you would like something different, say herbal, you have to go to the restaurant and pay $5 for the tea. Seems that they should carry at least a few extra varieties for the $40 surcharge. Myâ€¦

review_text: First, the room was terrific. Clean, well-designed micro-studio with breathtaking views in the heart of new york, for the price point where I felt comfortable extending the stay without breaking my bank account. Cheers.  Second, the hotel itself is fresh out of the press, new to the neighborhood, yet, it is remarkable how well established it feels. -- thanks to its fantastic staff.  Third, the hotel staff was terrific -- Marissa, Alex, Sam -- were extremely helpful in assisting with the stay.  And last but not least, the location -- it is just perfect -- walking distance literally from anything you looking for in New York City, including Broadway.  The total package! An absolute gem of the neighborhood and the city.

review_text: My girlfriend and I came into the city for a fun girlâ€™s weekend away. We walked to the hotel from the Port Authority bus station, and it was doable even with small carryon sized suitcases and purses. Even though we got there several hours before check-in time, Monique was able to offer us an available room right away. The room was immediately inviting with a gorgeous city view, modern furnishings, and a comfy bed with plush pillows â€“ perfect to plop down on after a busy day in the city. My name was even written on the TV to welcome me as a personal touch! One of our favorite parts of the room was the full-sized bath and body products that were plant based and had a great relaxing mint scent. It would have been helpful to have hangers and a steamer, to release the wrinkles fromâ€¦

I arrived around 3:30pm which was prime check in time and there were a couple of people in front checking in.  When I got to the desk, Fouad assisted me through the process.  I could have used online check in via the Hilton Honors app however I like to get that personal touch and learn about the property.  Fouad did not disappoint and he provided me information about the hours of breakfast, dining on property, utilization of key to access elevator and offered assistance for any questions.  I took a bit longer than other guests so when the other agents -  Marissa, Hector & Aziz were no longer assisting guests, theyâ€¦

review_text: This hotel has it all- prime location, trendy vibe, great food and breathtaking views. If you are coming to NYC to really get that authentic Big Apple experience, then this hotel is the one for you. It really elevates the experience and would recommend this to anyone who values really well thought out spaces that are great to lounge, think and have a coffee/beer in. The room was small but that's expected of hotels in the city. The vastness of the view and the feeling that you're on top of the city makes up for it.

review_text: My best friends and I stayed at the Motto Hotel March 4th through the 6th of 2022. We were lucky enough to be able to reunite at a beautiful brand new hotel that made our city experience  10x more enjoyable. We stayed in the four bunk room which took us back to old times when we were college roommates with one another. It was absolutely pristine. One night we spent time at the restaurant and bar where Baron, Isiah, Marco, and a few other staff members served us and gave us 5 star service. They were all entirely friendly and kind! The general manager, Bassim, made for great experience and was very pleasant. I would 100% recommend this hotel, great location, great vibe, and a spectacular team! Thank you for a fantastic stay, we will definitely be back!!

review_text: My husband and I stayed at the Motto Hotel March 5th, 2022. Upon our arrival we entered into the super chic lobby where no detail was forgotten. It was absolutely stunning. Within seconds of walking into the Lobby the loud hustle and bustle outside the glass doors was left behind and our city getaway had begun. We were greeted by an extra friendly and professional front desk staff. There also was a security guard in the lobby making sure things were flowing right, which I liked knowing someone was watching the traffic of who was coming and who was going. After checking in, our bags were held for us while we sat down in the Lobby and had an absolutely delicious bite to eat. I had the grilled octopus and I just couldn't get enough of the flavors. The octopus was cooked beyondâ€¦

review_text: Motel by Hilton is a newly built hotel in the heart of Chelsea. Our room was located on the 33rd floor of the building. The view was absolutely amazing overlooking the city. The room was decently sized with a king size bed, very comfortable. The bathroom had a really cool lighting however the door is extremely heavy so be very careful as the door slammed on my fingers really hard. The amenities in the room were also really cool that a smart TV with free showtime you can also log into your Netflix. Additionally there is also some really great bath shampoo and conditioner in the bathrooms that smell really fresh almost like eucalyptus. The sink was actually outside of the bathroom, FYI. The staff at Moto were very friendly and helpful. Thereâ€™s also a lounge in the hotel on theâ€¦

review_text: I planned a night out in nyc for my husbandâ€™s birthday and was looking for a hotel to stay over for a night after dinner and drinks.  We were lucky enough to meet the general manager Bassim at motto hotel who treated us like royalty.  The hotel just opened months ago so with that said everything from the decor to the rooms were impeccable.  I would say what stood out the most to us was the service we received from Bassim and his staff. Outstanding!! I would recommend this hotel to anyone and we will definitely be back in the near future.

review_text: We were so fortunate to find this great hotel in NYC. Aziz who we first met in our first stay here welcomed us in our second stay as well. He was so nice and welcoming and even upgraded our room so that we do not have to visit empire state as the room has some spectacular views over NYC. Haha!  We stayed a handful of those which struggle to keep up with the ultimate quality of this hotel. Special thanks goes to Aziz and Jojo who welcomed us warmly both times we stayed here. If you are hesitant about finding the perfect place do not any more! P.S. We also highly recommend the hotels own loyalty programme called Hilton Honors. Thanks Aziz and Jojo and other members of staff who made our stay comfortable.

review_text: The Motto is one of the best and upcoming NYC hotels Iâ€™ve ever seen/been. Gorgeous ambiance, staff was incredibly helpful, and the room was to die for. Hector was such great help when he realized my stay wasnâ€™t the correct amount of nights I needed but didnâ€™t hesitate to fix it for me. Was also convenient that the bar had extra bottle openers to give me to open some drinks I had in my room. Stayed on the 22nd floor with gorgeous views and was a good size for an NYC hotel. review_text: We came into NYC for a concert at MSG.  Motto was a perfect Chelsea location within walking distance to MSG and also many other attractions in the area.  Everything was clean and designed perfectly.  It also offered amazing city views.  We enjoyed dinner at the on site restaurant which had excellent food.  We will definitely be back to stay again.

review_text: My first stay at the Motto was relatively without issue. If it hadnâ€™t rained the first night, it would have been the perfect staycation. The Motto Chelsea is a funky and modern yet no-frills approach to lodging in the big city.   Aside from the wall-mounted suitcase rack just inside the door and hooks on almost every wall for jackets/towels etc. the neatest part of the king bed frame is the cutouts in the bottom to store your extra luggage.   I had a fantastic 30th floor view of the Freedom Tower and even had a little desk nook next to the bed where I was able to take professional Zoom calls when necessary.   The bed was super comfy, the shower was mood-changing, and the room just big enough to not feel like I was staying in a closet, like other rooms Iâ€™ve seen in NYC!  â€¦

review_text: Just wow! At the time of my stay (Feb 2022), they were only open for a little over a month. AMAZING staff, AMAZING room, and AMAZING location. Just a block away from the 23rd subway station, two blocks from Flatiron (Harry Potter Store is there). The staff was extremely helpful and nice. Mark my words, my new favorite Hilton location in the city, and will be back. Way to go Motto!

review_text: Last weekend, I stayed here with friends and had a wonderful time from check-in to check out. Monique, who works at the front desk, is excellent! She's kind, helpful, and anticipates guests' needs. Also,  we all enjoyed our food by celebrity chef Fabio Viviani. Viviani is lovely. The rooms were clean, thoughtfully designed (storage for suitcases under the bed and drawers for guests), and well-appointed with lots of bright light.

review_text: Amazing hotel and location! My wife and I visited for the weekend to meet up with a few of our friends who live in the area and we couldn't have found a better hotel! The team, especially Aziz, was wonderful. Gorgeous views right in the middle of it all. Walking distance to union station, great access to the subway, and a ton of things to do in the area. The hotel has a great restaurant on the first floor and a comfortable lounge on the second floor which would make this not just a great weekend place, but an awesome place to work from during the week!

review_text: This was a perfect weekend getaway for two tired parents! Upon our arrival we were received by our highly accommodating hostess, Monica. The rest of the staff also went above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable. Our first evening we ate in the restaurant behind the lobby and the food was impeccable. I had the excellent codfish with grits and my husband had an amazing burger and fries. We shared wings that were glazed with a sweet and spicy sauce. There were no leftovers!!  Our room was immaculate with smart and thoughtful design, storage, and furniture choices. Entering the room and reading my name on the TV welcoming me, was most memorable. The bathroom was beautiful with ample complimentary shampoo, conditioner and liquid soap that smelled amazing. The breathtaking cityâ€¦

review_text: Excellent in all aspects. Location, cleanliness, comfort, attention, and design. I found it to be an amazing hotel, which fully exceeded my expectations; everything is brand new. They received us with a glass of champagne at the check-in, which was very nice.  Clean, modern, very well furnished, and beautiful bathrooms. The view from my room was breathtaking. Kudos to Front Desk Manager Marissa and the front office agents Alexis and Fouad. They were very attentive and helpful. The restaurant and bar offered delicious food and amazing drinks. I highly recommend this property for either business or pleasure and I will definitely be staying here again.

review_text: The Motto Hotel was an amazing stay in Chelsea. We were there for a quick getaway. The entry into the hotel is very modern with clean lines and gray hues. The ambiance and decor upon arriving at the front desk is very warm and welcoming with an amber undertone. Check in was quick and efficient. Our room was 3003 which has an outstanding view of  South of Chelsea including the World Trade Center. The size of the room is comparable to a Miami boutique size with plenty of modern amenities and a unique use of space. The staff was kind and friendly. Overall Iâ€™d stay there again.

The front desk staff were super friendly. Highly recommend!

review_text: Really well-located (near multiple subway lines and close to Penn Station plus so many amenities and walking distance to all happening on the West side/Hudson Yards areas) boutique property. High end finishes throughout and nicely designed with lots of jewel tones and glass. (Although less than two months from opening, tiles already missing in the bathroom in the room we stayed in.) Sandwiched between other tall buildings so no real view for many rooms (and quite open to other properties) if you're not in a king room (please note - triples and double bunks are all on the side of the building that DOES NOT afford a view). Lovely lobby and bar/restaurant area with coffee/bakery service (although hours did not include late evening which was inconvenient). One of the most strikingâ€¦

review_text: Recently had a staycation at this brand new micro hotel. My stay was nothing short of amazing. My partner and I enjoyed amenities such as the communal lounge to get some work done, to the in-house gym, to the restaurant as well as the bar. It was definitely a much needed and well worth it stay. There was so much to do right within the hotel but you are in prime location within walking distance to wherever your heart desires. Chelsea market as well as the high line made for a nice walk and capped off the day with a relaxing view (maybe the best view) of the city. Will definitely be visiting again.

review_text: I can't say enough good things about this fab new "concept" hotel. I've stayed at similar chains (Pestana, citizenM, stayPineapple) and this is BY FAR the best. The rooms are much more spacious than we expected, and designed very cleverly. The decor is great, the staff are wonderful, and the beds, towels, and toiletries are very high quality. The lobby bar (Bar Ciccetti) is very chic, and there's an enormous lounge with beautiful furniture on the second floor open to guests to use at any time.   We were lucky enough to get a parking space right on 24th Street, which is free on weekends. A ton of bars, restaurants, and stores are within walking distance (highly recommend the Great Jones Distillery for drinks, the Knickerbocker Bar & Grill for dinner, and Hole in the Wall forâ€¦

review_text: Outstanding  hotel at a very reasonable  price in the heart of Chelsea. Saw Billy Joel  at the garden  and walked back to the Motto in 15 minutes. Jojo and the front desk crew were super accommodating.

review_text: I don't normally write reviews of hotels, but I had to write a review of the Motto hotel. I had an amazing experience staying here, from the welcoming nature of the lobby host who actually texted me 5 mins after to ensure I was pleased with the room. The room was perfect, clean and new with an amazing beautiful view of lower Manhattan. I had dinner at the Italian  restaurant downstairs, the food was amazing, while sitting the manager of the hotel walked over and introduced himself and talked about the plans for the Hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel :)

The room was perfect, clean and new with an amazing beautiful view of lower Manhattan. I had dinner at the Italian  restaurant downstairs, the food was amazing, while sitting the manager of the hotel walked over and introduced himself and talked about the plans for the Hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel :)

review_text: This hotel is the perfect location for a visit to NYC.  Locatedi n the middle between theaters and downtown.  Our room was beautiful, clean and brand new.  Love the color schemes and the bed was very comfortable.  You cannot beat the gorgeous views of the new Freedom tower and the sunsets to the west.  We had dinner at the restaurant, Bar Cicchetti at the Motto, and it was first class and they could not have been more accommodating from the waiter, Robert, whom we loved, to the GM and Associate GM who were very helpful.  The bar staff and breakfast staff were the best. The staff at the front desk were all very helpful and friendly, as well.  All aimed to please and to help.  Hard to leave with such wonderful people around!!  We are so excited with the prospect of returning againâ€¦

review_text: First time here and what an amazing experience. The staff was so welcoming and kind, especially Travis, he helped me book extra nights so easily and was very responsive when i needed to make last minute changes. The Restaurant and food were absolutely phenomenal. My favorite part though was the VIEW from my room. Breathtaking is the only way to describe it. I travel a lot for work and have stayed at a lot of different hotels in the city, this has been my favorite and i will absolutely be back. 10 / 10 recommend this Hotel!

review_text: What a beautiful hotel!!! Our room was amazing! Small, but in a 'small house' kind of way where the space was really nicely utilized. The bed was HUGE (and dangerously comfortable) and the view was something else. On our second night we decided to get takeout and watch the sunset from our room rather than go out to eat.  Housekeeping had our room looking fresh whenever we came back from our day out. Shower is 10/10 with adjustable water pressure. The common areas are clean and comfortable. The room was so quiet that with the blackout curtains I could have slept all day.  Location wise: it is literally walking distance to everything you could want. Dive bars to fancy restaurants this neighborhood has it all. The whole weekend we just stayed in the neighborhood and walkedâ€¦

review_text: Our stay at Motto Hilton was more than exceptional. The rooms were spacious and comfortable with a modern flare. We were fortunate enough to have the option to create an ample suite through connecting rooms.  The view from our suite was breathtaking and the location was more than convenient with shops and restaurants at walking distance. The train station is less than 2 blocks away making it very commutable.  I would definitely recommend this great hotel to all my family and friends when visiting the big Apple.

review_text: Loved my stay!!!  The location was super convenient, the staff was very friendly especially Aziz, Hector and Alex. They were very accommodating and assisted me with my many requests. The hotel is brand new and very modern. There is a restaurant  so need to bother stepping out of the hotel. In the morning there is also an area to place breakfast orders and coffee which is a must for those of us who need coffee before starting their day. The hotel was very clean and housekeeping was on top of the smallest details in the room. Always restocking what needed be without having to ask. Loved the full length mirror and lighting on the vanity! I will be back soon and have already recommend this hotel to my friends and family!

review_text: We stayed in the New Motto in NYC for one night seeking to have an out of the regular routine day and we are pleased to say that this hotel is excellent,  the staff at the reception were very diligent and very friendly, they fulfilled our expectations we really enjoyed our stay. We were on a 37th floor room, the view to lower Manhattan was breathtaking, even our dog enjoyed the view, the room had everything you'll need, the food in the restaurant was amazing, we even had the pleasure to meet the famous chef Fabio Viviani, the drinks at the bar were also expectacular. We will definitely stay in this hotel again.

review_text: GORGEOUS and FUN hotel!! Incredible views from our room on the 41st floor. The room itself was sparkling clean, had slippers and luxury shampoo/soaps etc. Mixed metal fixtures, big tv and tons of wall hooks to hang your bags and coats out of the way in the room. The restaurant was lively, delicious and the perfect pre-game to our night at MSG. The host, our waitress Sophia and the rest of the staff of the restaurant & hotel were all so fun and welcoming. Wish we could have stayed longer!! Get the tiramisu with white chocolate for dessert!!

review_text: I work around the neighborhood of Chelsea and found a Motto hotel by Hilton. I have tried their restaurant a few times since the restaurant's opening. Lovely atmosphere of the restaurant and lounge. Friendly staff and love all the food they serve at the restaurant.  I have busy work schedules, and I need a local getaway, so I also decided to try the hotel and make a reservation with Hector for staying in the hotel, and he arranged my stay at 39floorsr with a beautiful night view of NYC.  Thank you Hector! And kudos for Karry the bartender who makes  delicious drinks. Helpful restaurant managers Baron and Alex  Last but not least, thank you for the chefs Dirk that provided me with the best special hot sauce! ( not on the menu )

review_text: We came upon this new hotel as we were driving along 6th avenue trying to find a parking space on a lazy Sunday and eventually decided to stay for the evening. At first sight the hotel was obviously in construction mode, finishing up the exterior details such as as the huge glass facade looking into 24th St. ; from the street, you have a clear view of the entirety of the interior - bar and a little of the upcoming restaurant. Upon our check in, we were welcomed by the manager on duty - Hector. He helped us go through the arrival process and even went to lengths in describing room options, pricing and brief introduction of the brand/hotel, to which we are grateful for his patience and hospitality. We decided to go for a room with 2 beds (full size) - little did we know Hectorâ€¦

review_text: We stayed here for a concert that was at Madison square garden. (Walking distance) The staff were very friendly, and attentive. Shortly after we got to our room we realized the bathroom door didnâ€™t close, we called down and within 10 minutes they had someone up there to fix it. The room was beautiful with an even better view! Loved being able to watch the sunrise in bed while being able to see the Statue of Liberty. The staff Sam was extremely helpful when it came time to check out. He helped us with our luggage and made sure to keep it safe while we were out in the city after our checkout time. His professionalism and attentiveness made us feel very welcome. We will be back and in hopes to have the same rooms with the beautiful views. This stay was worth every penny!

review_text: We stayed at Motto for a staycation with friends and couldnt be happier. Everyone at front desk was very friendly and accomodating. Check-in with Monique and Johanka was quick and seemless, and they also offer contactless check-in via app. We got a room on the highest floor and the view was just amazing! Rooms are well designed and they offer great amenities. Hotel is in the heart of Chelsea so you have many amazing restaurants and bars in a walking distance. Cant wait to go back!

From day 1, the staff has been attentive, friendly, talkative, and followed up to ensure I was always taken care of and had everything I needed. Clean rooms with smartly utilized spaces. Cannot wait to come back to Chelsea and stay in this beautifully designed and well managed hotel. 5 out of 5.

review_text: Motto is Hilton knocks it out of the park. The guestrooms are thoughtfully designed - functional and fashionable. Very thoughtful use of space with storage underneath the bed and hanging hooks for your jackets and belongings so you do not forget them. Sustainable bath amenities and the VIEW!!!! Beds are super comfortable. Outside our window the views are priceless NYC skyline views. Service phenomenal - the overnight crew Aziz and Marissa were super welcoming and provided a lot of information about the hotel upon arrival. Alex at the Front Desk was also very hospitable. Jessica the housekeeping manager greeted us with the biggest smile (yes even with the mask you can tell) and provided that Hilton touch. This takes Hilton's hotel game to another level of 21st century. Well doneâ€¦

review_text: My boyfriend and I visited the Motto hotel for a night on his 26th birthday and had a fabulous time. Upon arrival, we were greated immediately with enthusiasm and warmth which made us feel comfortable and welcome. I want to specifically mention Aziz at the front desk for his hospitality and eagerness when answering all of our questions. The check in process was very smooth and we were given a room on the 41st floor. The room was incredibly clean and tidy. We had a million dollar view of the World Trade Center, the Hudson River and the entire south end of city. The hotel itself is very close to a ton of attractions as itâ€™s location is in between Chelsea and Flatiron, the heart of the city. I could have not asked for a better stay!

review_text: I couldn't recommend a hotel experience more highly. Located in the prestigious and well-sought after Chelsea neighborhood, the motto was a luxury hotel experience with an incredible view from our room. My girlfriend and I enjoyed a romantic evening starting off in the room overlooking the entire city, followed by great drinks and bites at the hotel bar. Centrally located, we took a 10 minute cab ride into soho, and easily took the train back. In the morning, we had an incredible breakfast at the grey dog (2 minute walk). The service was nothing less than impeccable, accommodating all of our needs quickly and courteously, in addition to going above and beyond to make sure we had an incredible stay.

review_text: We stayed 3 nights at the Pods Time Square.  It's clean, in a great central location and just a couple blocks from the subway.  The  price was great for whatelse I was seeing so I took the chance.  Be aware, the rooms are TINY. We stayed in a bunk bed room on the 20th floor and had a great view of various buildings.  No complaints for what it is and I'd stay again if budget minded.  Staff is nice and helpful and while we didn't do any of them, they seemed to have free walking tours most mornings for different areas of Manhattan.

review_text: Early March 2022 trip to see American Utopia and The Music Man. Ticket prices being what they are, we looked for a bargain hotel. The Pod Times Square was less than $100/night for 2 single bunk beds, a metal chair, and a small clean toilet, sink and shower. The room feels like a sleeper car on a train, or a small cruise ship room. Very compact, not a place to hang out in. (For those who intend to try, each bed has it's own reading light and television, and there are plenty of plugs & USB ports for phones, watches, etc.) There is a safe too, although ours didn't lock properly.  The front desk crew was friendly and welcoming. We were able to get into our room at noon on check in day, which probably won't be typical as tourism picks up in NYC. One. of the economies is that the roomâ€¦

review_text: This hotel was super convenient for a quick weekend full of Broadway shows. We stayed in one of the bunk bed rooms- the room was tiny, but that was expected. It kind of felt like we were on a cruise ship. The hotel was very affordable and everyone we spoke to was very kind and helpful. The room itself was very clean and the beds were comfortable. It was nice to each have our own tv! Plus we had a great view of the City. I would definitely stay here again!

While I donâ€™t go to NYC to go to Time Square, it is a short walk away, along with other tourist hot spots like theaters. review_text: We had a great time at Pod Times Square. The rooms were perfect for what we needed, it was clean, we slept great, we felt safe, and loved the location to so much great food and to broadway shows - we could also walk to Central Park although it is a bit longer of a walk. Check in was later than we thought (3pm), but the hotel held our bags so we could go explore. Check out was so quick and easy.  Wonderful time at this hotel and would definitely stay again!

review_text: Great location, clean/well-kept rooms, easy check-in/out, but there were a few cons. With the great location comes the city noise. Non-stop honking and sirens from emergency vehicles outside. Obviously we knew the room would be pretty small going into it, but it was smaller than we imagined. We were constantly saying "sorry" or "can I slide past you" when doing anything besides sleeping in the bunks. And lastly, the beds were very uncomfortable. My roommate woke up sore after the first night (and we hadn't even done any walking yet). I understand being a hotel that is not designed for hanging out in the room for long periods of time, but I don't think the mattresses were a place to cut corners. You want to be able to get a good night's sleep after a long day spent traipsingâ€¦

review_text: This was a great value hotel. Nothing fancy in terms of the room, but it was clean and comfortable. The decor was modern and simple which made it feel like a high end boutique hotel. Staff was great even though they were busy being New Years week. Location was great. We only had to walk a few blocks to get to Times Square and subway stations. Plenty of food options in the area. We stayed in the bunk pod and it was fun. We liked having our own personal TVâ€™s and electronics area on the wall. The bathroom was small, but had everything we needed. Clean and bright. The rain head shower was amazing after long days exploring the city. The heater worked great and the beds were firm, but comfortable. I would stay here again to save some money. And even if you donâ€™t need to itâ€™s a greatâ€¦

review_text: Upon arrival desk staff were inattentive, failing even to acknowledge that we were waiting next in line while they attended to other business. (Some didn't seem to be working at all.) Except for one helpful staffer who recommended a breakfast place, desk staff were haughty and rude. Thankfully, the rooms are commodious and efficient like in a cruise ship: clean en suite bath; new beds with comfortable mattresses; oversized louvred shutters with great city views. The lack of closets is compounded by providing only one luggage stand. The location and price are great, but improvements are needed.

review_text: Booked a queen room, 12/10-12, holiday, busy in NYC.  Dropped off our bags, toured the city, checked in and was told they oversold and could only offer us bunk beds.  No concern for what we booked or any consideration for our age.  I said it was unacceptable, that I wanted a queen beds and the front desk person offered for me to cancel the reservation, nothing more.  I booked through a third party and knew I could not get my money back if I cancelled the reservation, so he was basically offering me nothing. I asked to speak to the manager - John Paul, and he told me he would comp us the first night and give us a free drink at the bar.  This was at 10pm and we were very tired so we accepted, went up to the room and went to bed.  an hour later (we were asleep), John Paul calledâ€¦

review_text: PTS is our favorite place to stay in NYC. There is a lot to like here. Super modern and clean. Convenient location a block from the Port Authority (buses to EWR and the Woodbury Common Outlet Mall) . Awesome views from floor to ceiling windows with a pleasant surprise - they open a crack to let in fresh air! Service is professional and friendly (Sahar in reception).  The bunk beds are comfortable. Roomy shower. Plentiful outlets for charging devices. Enough elevators so no waiting or crowding. And all at bargain rates!

review_text: I was a little confused finding thr lobby.  Was on thr 9th floor.  So elevator up , check in with Sahar at front desk, very smooth and upgraded from bunk bed to single bed. Elevator to floor, lol.  Need to swipe security transponder in elevator and then hit floor.  Room:  small, clean, efficient, all I needed.  Heating system in room works very well.  19th floor view of Manhattan, cool.  Only a ten minute walk to Penn Station.  Loved shower with overhead shower head.  Convenient location.  Everything just fine and at half the price of most hotels.  It has everything I needed, internet, tv, bed, nice bathroom and shower. Just a bit smaller.  Will return.

review_text: This is a bare bones budget hotel in a great part of town if you want to be near Times Square.  I booked a hotel room for 3 nights because I was taking the red eye into the city and wanted to check directly into my room when I arrived at 8 am.  I called to let them know that I'd be checking in late and the front desk person on the phone said they will make a note of it and hold my room for me (the one I am paying a full night for!) so that it would be ready when I arrived the next morning.    By the time I landed, I got a note from the hotel saying they oversold the hotel and my room type was not available, but they'd offer us a bunk bed room to use when we got in and then they'd move us to the full sized room we paid for.    When we got to the hotel around 8 am, I told theâ€¦

review_text: For the price and location (and time of year we went, holiday season) - we were impressed. While the rooms are definitely pods and I don't recommend booking the room with someone you aren't very comfortable with, they were everything we needed  -a comfortable place to sleep, a bathroom, close access to the subway and Times Square, and a very affordable price in comparison to other hotels.   You are one stop from Macys / 34th Penn Station which is great for connecting trains and a 50 minute / $50 uber away from LGA. We like to walk and had no problem walking up broadway to Central Park and down 5th Ave as well.  We didn't talk to staff often but when we did, they were very accommodating and polite. Ate at the restaurant on site at about 7:30 pm on a Friday night and had no issuesâ€¦

review_text: Not great. Hidden fees that they tack on once you are ready to confirm your reservation. Would not take one of my credit cards for payment. I had to use a different credit card that does not give me rewards. Rooms were not cleaned. Loud door slamming mid-morning so don't expect to sleep in. Never offered me the "free cocktail" at their restaurant (Serafina) that was initially promised. Rooms are not as nice as appear in their photos on website. The only thing I really liked was the location. But if homeless people and trash on street bother you this is not the place for you. Not impressed.

other: Would not take one of my credit cards for payment. I had to use a different credit card that does not give me rewards. But if homeless people and trash on street bother you this is not the place for you. Not impressed.

review_text: Quite close to times square Subway, eateries, theaters You'll hear the bathroom  Yes, theater and you'll count as one syllable in my book.  Had an incident the first night in the hotel. Their computer system messed up and apparently I wasn't supposed to be in my room. Hotel engineer tried to get in to my room around 11pm, scared the heck out of me. I shouted that the room was occupied. Employee apologized, and I spoke with Mgr Anthony about it in the morning. Anthony was very understanding and apologetic, and the situation was rectified to my satisfaction.  Good neighborhood, nice bar on the lobby floor, and comfortable bed. The room is small and there is a sliding door on the bathroom, so if you're traveling with someone, it will be quite intimate.

review_text: I stayed at The Pod Times Square for two nights, November 2 & 3.  I got an excellent price through Hotels.com.  The room was very quiet.  The bunkhouse bed comfortable for my 6"3 body and the shower's hot water came on immediately.  Hotel was clean and I would not hesitate to stay again if the price was right.  Location is very convenient to Shows and the subway is one block away if needed.  However I had an issue at check in with customer service.  When I arrived and stood for my turn for check in, there were SEVEN employees behind the counter.  Only one was actually checking people in.  I have no clue what the other six were doing.  But two employees (one being a Manager) stood on each side of the one employee, talking full volume.  There was already a plexy glass and withâ€¦

review_text: This is very much you get what you pay for. Was just looking for a cheap hotel for a last minute weekend trip. The staff was so helpful and the hotel was clean. The rooms are tiny but i knew that going in. I also knew there were no amenities but i mean absolutely none. I think i assumed we'd still have an ice bucket and coffee maker but no. Theres absolutely nothing at all. But once again, I knew going into it this was a no frills hotel. And for what this trip was, it was fine. Had i stayed any longer, id have been booking a different hotel. We had a bunk pod so I spent a lot of time on my bed when we were in the room cuz there was no room for two people any other way. The beds each have their own TV and cubbies to hold your phone and headphones and I put my water on top. Lotsâ€¦

review_text: This was a great hotel for the purpose of our trip. I can see how people would be disappointed if they're expecting lots of "extras"-- there is no refrigerator or microwave, the rooms are very small, housekeeping had to be called due to the pandemic-- but these things are clearly advertised online, so guests shouldn't be surprised. The room was pretty quiet despite the downtown location. The private bathroom was a nice plus. We'd definitely recommend to others who are planning to be out and about most of the day and just want a simple place to crash overnight.

review_text: When in New York, you barely spend time in your room, so the Hotel keeps things simple and functional. You have your bed, bathroom, desk, chair, decent amount of power outlets, tv and such an overwhelming view of the Hudson from your bedroom. Of course Covid has its inherent restrictions but if you ask downstairs, there will be cleanse service daily if you want. Staff is amazing and super helpful. In cost-benefit terms, the value paid is more than fair. Also you have access to a great market just around the corner. Pretty neat, not to mention the location. Perfect for touring the main attractions of the city.

review_text: I have alway wanted to stay at a POD and I just spent two nights.  Some observations: 1. No rest room available to incoming or current guest on the lobby floor. 2. Was not able to check-in luggage after checking out. 3. Lounge was very aesthetically unpleasing. 4. My room was not cleaned once over two days. 5. Hotel for people not needing to spend time in hotel room- no refrigerator, no microwave, gigantic safe(which I used). 6. Bedding came apart during the night which exposed a blanket that was used before. 7. Getting someone to answer at the hotel desk was a nightmare. 8.I did not see any ice service. 9. No coffee maker in room and none available in the lobby. 10.No outlet for computer at the desk. 11. Absolutely great location for stores, cafÃ©s, markets. 12.Leaving theâ€¦

review_text: The Pod in Times Square is an incredible value! The rooms include private bathrooms and everything you need and more. The views are great in some rooms and it is in the middle of all the action in New York City! I have tried many hotels in the area and this one is by far my favorite! The staff are best in class and make everyone feel welcomed, providing outstanding service. This is a top hotel stay for fantastic value, especially for those who enjoy being out every evening enjoying all that NYC has to offer! Perks are not needed in the room when the city streets have so much to offer, and the efficiency studios are the nicest I have ever seen at the price point at most pods with private bathrooms. Fantastic hotel group! I cannot endorse the hotels highly enough, and this one isâ€¦

review_text: I booked a room in this hotel expecting at least normal customer service. They cancelled my booking trying to charge me while I was at the plane for 10 hours flying from one continent to another. They left me without my booking when I landed at JFK at 6 pm! They haven't waited until the end of the day. My booking was said "pay at the property". I had to rebook with more expensive price in this hotel because didn't have a choice. A room for 2 was kinda small. Few days later i was woken up at 2 am by fire alarm. A room was on the 23rd floor, when people were going downstairs they made an announcement that fire alarm worked in the certain room and that's it! review_text: Husband and I had a pleasant stay at the Pod Times Square. We reserved a cancellable queen pod way before NY re-opened to the world and got a great deal for $80/nt. It is on 42nd Ave, 3 blocks to Times Square and right next to the Port Authority subway station. Thereâ€™s a 7-11, Dunkin Donuts, kebab place & Chinese restaurant in front. They were quick to reply to my email questions about airport/subway directions from JFK. We were also able to check in and get into our room early. Thank you Mila!!!  The room (1714) is small, size is very similar to a cruise ship cabin, but we enjoyed the view, shower pressure, comfort of the mattress, scent of toiletries and overall security in the bldg despite the homeless situation in the general area. I highly recommend this no-frills hotel toâ€¦
