review_text: I have a fully flexible reservation for June that states it can be cancelled with 24 hours notice.  I made this reservation directly on the POD Times Square website.  I have not yet paid anything, but my credit card was taken to hold the reservation.  I attempted to cancel the reservation on their website, but the website says it can't cancel the reservation and gives an email address and a phone number to use to cancel.  I have tried to call that phone number, as well as the phone number on my reservation email, many times and there is never any answer, it just rings and rings.  I have emailed the email address on the website, replied to my reservation email, and emailed some direct emails that I saw in other Tripadvisor reviews, all requesting to cancel my reservation.  I haveâ€¦

review_text: My friend and I stayed here a few nights during our visit of the city. The location is simply perfect, about a 5 minute walk from Times Square. We opted for the cheapest room as we would not be in the hotel much. We were pleasantly surprised, the room had everything and more than we could have asked for and was very very clean. I was particularly happy about the bathroom which was in very new condition, with a proper shower. The room had two bunk beds which were very convenient. The view outside the window was breathtaking as well, with all the skyscrapers. Strongly recommend!

review_text: Fully enjoyed our stay at the pod Times Square! We came for my mums 50th birthday celebrations with myself, my partner and my mum and dad. We had two Queen rooms on the 17th floor, close together, and with a city view as requested! Not only did they meet our room requirements, they added extra touches in the room to make my mums birthday extra special!   The rooms themselves are a perfect size (yes they arenâ€™t huge rooms but this really wasnâ€™t a problem). There was enough room for the two of us, 2 hand-luggage cases and a large cabin case. We didnâ€™t stay in the hotel much as we were often out all day but the beds were comfortable after a long day of walking around.   Every single member of staff we spoke to were helpful, and cheery. Checking in and out was quick and easy. Couldâ€¦

review_text: this was a great location, close to Times Square and the theatre district.  I travelled with my daughter so the bunk single beds were ideal.  Although the rooms are small, they are perfect for a place to lay your head.  The room was thoughtfully laidout with plenty of plugs and USB ports.  Each bunk had it's own TV and shelf with 2 plugs and USBs (perfect to plug in my CPAP).  The staff was friendly, the concierge was helpful and on checkout, we were able to leave our luggage in storage until 10pm that evening! a perk to allow us a day of sightseeing before heading home.  They also discount parking at the conveniently located parking garage across the street.  Two nights of parking for $50USD

review_text: We were very pleased when we arrived at the Pod Hotel Times Square.  Our apartment was perfect.  Perfect location to access everything in Manhattan.  Clean and well appointed.  Wasn't too noisy.  I don't think you can get away from Sirens and Traffic noise until the early hours of the morning anywhere in Manhattan.  Had a small view of the Hudson River.  There were 8 of us all together.  The other rooms - Bunk Pod and Studio Pod were quite small, but you're not really in your room for long when you stay in New York.  You just need good Wifi, location and clean comfortable bed and the Pod Hotel ticked all of those boxes.  Would definately stay here again.

review_text: The location was about a 8-10min walk into Times Square  Going past madam Tussaud's and Ridley's believe it or not We got a Uber from Newark and it was about $56 one way . Rooms were small but it's just a Base, we had bunk beds and you know what it was fine, you get what you pay for and we only needed somewhere to sleep it's better then a hostel. The check in staff was lovely, in general I was pleased with all the staff.  The cool bar looked fab, but I didn't get a chance to use it.  There was a 99cent pizza shop outside. They provided shampoo and body wash, towels and a kettle if you need it.  Tv was great and I loved the little touches by the bedside like charging points USB and plug, night light  I would stay here again, but ideally need to be a bit more closer to Timesâ€¦

review_text: I knew from visiting their website that I was going to like the Pod Times Square. But the hotel exceeded my expectations. It was a great value. review_text: My sister and I stayed here for 2 nights as we were passjng through the city. This hotel really exceeded our expectations, we encountered the very helpful and welcoming Sahar when checking in she made our check in seamless and easy. The room itself was exactly what we needed for our short stay very clean with everything we needed. The hotel is very well situated, a short walk to times square and located very close to Port Authority. Will definitely be back.

review_text: We visited NY for the first time for a 3 night stay over my partners birthday. I emailed in advance and asked if they could do something special in the room - when we arrived there was a hand signed birthday card and some fresh cakes! Such a lovely touch. And they kindly gave us a high up room on the 20th floor.  The room itself is small, as the name pod suggests. But it was decorated nicely, clean and has clever hooks and storage under the bed. The shower was big and the toiletries smelt nice.  This is perfect central location for Times square but walking distance to so many other activities.   We would absolutely stay here again!

review_text: If you are touring around NYC and want a clean hotel room near Time Square and the Subway, stay at the Pod! I was here for one week and found the location to be better and better each day. It is a ten minute walk to Time Square, as a tourist, what more could you want?! Lot's of food and coffee shops near by as well. I will add, after five wonderful days of coming back to a cleaned room with fresh towels, the room service stopped. I found this to be very odd. One person at the front desk was very sorry when I called and said he would make sure the room was cleaned the next day. It was not cleaned and the next person I talked to didn't seem to care.

review_text: Just back from staying at the Pod for a week with my niece.  We had an amazing stay, we loved it! All staff are friendly and helpful always shouting hello to us when we were coming and going.  We only went into the bar once as it wasn't really our scene but it always had people in there.  The rooms are small as expected but there was enough room for us with 2 suitcase and 2 hand luggage cases in there.  They were cleaned daily and the whole hotel smelt lovely, very noticeable as soon as you come through the door.  Location wise it was situated perfectly just off Times Square, very central.  As we got a weekly subway pass it was great as there's a few subway stations close to the hotel.  Reading previous reviews mentioning the homeless community nearby we didn't find this to be aâ€¦

review_text: I had the pleasure of staying at the Pod Times Square again, however, this time during the New Year holiday. As you can imagine, during this particular time of the year, Times Square is more busy than usual. The New Year was about to start on an ill note after realizing an error made, on my part, for my reservation. Thankfully, the team at the front desk, specifically Kathy, was able to alleviate my anxiety and accommodate me as needed. Kathy handled my ordeal promptly and with an infectious smile. In no time, I was on my way to unpacking and joining the planned festivities for the New Year.   Again, think of the horror-New Year's Eve, Times Square, and an oversight you have made booking your reservation. It warrants the feeling of fear and anxiety; however, I am comforted thatâ€¦

review_text: First time to New York on business, this place although had great reviews was only $70 / night (excluding taxes which is not their fault) so was a little skeptical, but hey here on work so wont be here much anyway!  Hotel is simply put incredible. For the price, the rooms are big enough that you donâ€™t get claustrophobia like I was expecting from some reviews, rooms look like they were cleverly designed by IKEA for maximum room. Super clean throughout the rooms and hotel, easy to walk to the Javits center and all the major attractions, the drinks in the bar down stairs will blow your head off if you drink more than 2, so I donâ€™t know what else I could have asked for only spending $70 / night!  Donâ€™t worry about bringing all your chargers, they have USB outlets throughout the roomâ€¦

review_text: We had an absolutely amazing stay at Pod Times Square.  Everything was perfect - location, staff, comfort, cleanliness. Would  highly recommend.   We had a lovely surprise when we arrived in our room, we had been upgraded and had balloon and a card wishing us a happy anniversary, this was so kind and thoughtful.   We arrived by bus from Philly and the station was just up the street which was perfect with so much luggage.   Can not recommend a better hotel for a NYC stay.

Good food, good value and good coffee ðŸ‘  The hotel is perfectly located. We were a little dazed after a long journey from the UK. Receptionist was brief and cordial. A brief on the lift system might have been useful but a friendly fellow guest helped us with the system. Use room key card to be able to access the floor you need.    The Corridors - very industrial and dark looking slightly horror movie'esq. Got much better in the room.  The Room - great. Clean functional and comfy beds. Frosted glass separates the bed area and bathroom. Not great when sharing with teenage son. The sliding door didn't close either.â€¦

review_text: Just stayed at the Pod for 5 days for a work trip. Location was excellent to get to the Javits center for a conference. Plenty of dinining options near by; never had a meal at the Polynesian room on the premis, but had a couple of drinks and coffee and pastry in the morning. Room was very clean, nice shower setup and the beds were elevated to allow for storage underneath. There was a little desk to get some work done. One slight annoyance is the two elevator banks you have to take to get to your room; especially when the one to the lobby broke down for a couple days. Three minor cons were no in room coffee, nolotion (I asked at front desk and they did not have any) and just the street noise. CUSTOMER SERVICE WAS TOP NOTCH. Asked for an iron, showed up in 5min. Huge shout out toâ€¦

Wellington even remembered us the next day and wanted to make sure that we were enjoying our stay. The hotel is located close to so much and we were able to walk to all of our activities. We will definitely book this hotel next time we stay in NYC.

review_text: We just returned from a two night stay at the Residence Inn New York Downtown Manhattan/World Trade Center Area and I can't recommended it enough!!! The property is steps away from the gorgeous Brooklyn Bridge and the World Trade Center.  There are convenient Subway locations all around as well. Special shout to Jane at the front desk and the rest of the staff, everyone was extremely welcoming and accommodating. The Maiden Lane studio suite was extremely comfortable (much bigger than most NY hotel rooms) and we appreciate the hospitality!!!  Breakfast was excellent and a perfect way to start the day. Our package included parking on 80 Gold Street (5-10 minutes walk and easy in and out). We look forward to another stay in the future!!!

review_text: It was my first time staying here, I really like the hotel for its cleanliness and location. It is close to occulus, westfield mall and WTC area.  The service was good and staff very friendly and attentive. The breakfast is basic, bagels, cereals and juice. There is also a starbucks vending machine. There are a few fast food places nearby and also some nice restaurants if you walk towards Tribeca, about 10-15 mins away.

review_text: A few minor issues really ruined the potential of this stay. Although I have status and booked an executive room, I was put into a room that was a total dark cave. The internal room gave no natural light. Sadly, my shower handle was broken and didnâ€™t allow for a hot shower. I informed reception at around 12:30pm and upon my return at 6:30pm, it had not been addressed so I reached back out and was informed that an engineer would come up. I went to dinner and at around 8:30pm, they let me know that they could not fix it and offered to move my room, but because I didnâ€™t plan on being back until late, I had to decline. There were a few redeeming qualities about the room. Frankly it was one of the largest NYC hotel rooms I have ever stayed in and the bed was very comfortable. Having a Kitchenette was very nice and the room was very clean. I would be willing to try again for another stay but hopefully they address the shower before renting the room (1016) again.â€¦

review_text: I live locally in Brooklyn and came back from a Florida vacation only to find out the massive renovations my sister started on our house were way behind schedule, and there was no power or water. I was pretty desperate for a decent place to stay for a few days, preferably close to work since we have come back to the office, and remembered this Residence Inn I pass daily on my way to work every day. It was a great decision in every respect!  The King studio I was in was quiet, clean, and well appointed with a decent little kitchenette. Covid procedures were excellent, free breakfast was prepackaged and everything felt safe.   And when what I thought would be a couple of nights turned into a couple of weeks, the staff was extremely accommodating and took care of all my needs.â€¦

review_text: Our experience at Residence Inn Manhattan World Trade Center was by no means as positive as our numerous previous stays at Residence Inn Manhattan Times Square!  Prior to arrival I contacted the hotel through my app, and inquired if any upgrades were available, thinking that perhaps due to lowered occupancy, we might get a suite with a view.  I was told the only upgrade would be to a room with 2 Queen beds which did not appeal to us.  I certainly did not have a view, the room was dark due to looking out into a small space surrounded by buildings.  While most of the staff were outstanding in pleasantries, professionalism and welcoming my wife and I, with one exception, and unfortunately he did not wear an ID to know his name!  Both times that I had the misfortune of needing to goâ€¦

review_text: We stayed at this hotel for one night and from the moment we entered to the moment we left, Jane took such wonderful care of us.  Immediately when I arrived Jane gave the most genuine smile and welcomed me to the hotel and also said that I got upgraded.  Once I got to my room she texted me to make sure everything was good.  The next morning I went looking for coffee and much to my surprise there was Jane again.  Although they didnâ€™t have coffee Jane offered me a bottled coffee drink instead.  So nice:). I am so glad that I met Jane as she made our trip extremely special.  When visiting the city again I would have no issues staying at this hotel.  The people are really what make it a great place.  Thank you Jane for your wonderful hospitality and service.

review_text: Generally, I enjoy Marriott hotels. Iâ€™ve been here, before, too, and have raved about this place. As we arrived, the gentleman watching the door, was on his phone, and took a few seconds to open the front door.  During Covid, there is no breakfast, not even coffee to take back to your room. Though there are coffee makers in each roomâ€”the coffee is weak and not really replaced well. Additionally, we bought food at Eataly, and used the dishes, but there was no soap or sponges to clean dishes. Even the dishwasher detergent was not replaced. A little disappointing for a veteran of Residence hotels.  Frankly this was an escape for us from my parents, with whom we are living in a careful podâ€”this was our relaxing getaway. Again, while I appreciate Marriott brands, and normally thisâ€¦

review_text: Stayed for 5 nights in a studio with two double beds.  Our room was very spacious and had a small kitchen with full fridge, dishwasher and microwave - very handy since NYC restaurants are closed for indoor dining. Lots of storage space and a big desk.  Staff were attentive at all times, there are vending machines in the lobby for snacks/drinks and a free laundry room.   Location is good, a few steps away from Oculus and access to multiple subway lines (although we didn't use them bc of Covid).  The hotel doesn't say much from the outside and the Lobby is located in the first floor, entrance is through a small street called Maiden Ln. Overall, I think it was good value for what we paid and we felt safe. Good choice for families looking for a bigger room with kitchen area orâ€¦

review_text: We are currently here as I recover from surgery. The entire hotel is spotless, from the room to the public spaces. Staff are following all COVID-19 regulations with masks, gloves, and sanitizing stations at every elevator. The entire staff here is wonderful and very guest-oriented. A special thank you to Max at the front door for his smile and help; Ricky at the front desk for always being there with a suggestion; and especially John Stefanides, who has made the very imperfect situation of surgery during COVID as comfortable for me as humanly possible.

review_text: I was booked into the Residence Inn Downtown Manhattan by my insurance after a fire in my building in Brooklyn left me displaced from my home. I needed a pet-friendly location to move to immediately that would also have enough space to let me continue to work from "home". The housing department at my insurance company found this hotel, and I'm so very happy that they did.  I ended up staying at the Residence Inn for two and a half months before the insurance finally found me an apartment to stay in for the rest of the time until the repairs in our building are completed. For that ENTIRE stay, I experienced nothing but friendly service and a sincere attempt to make me feel at home. It worked, to the point that when it was time to move to the apartment, I found myself sharingâ€¦

I reserved the RI WTC for a girls weekend for my friendâ€™s birthday. This has been a tradition for the past few years and we typically stay at a Marriott hotel in tropical weather. Due to covid, we were hesitant to travel but still wanted that â€œsuite lifeâ€ experience. Residence Inn WTC, had great reviews and the Maiden Lane suite seemed perfect. The downside was that we would be vacationing without some of the amenities we were used to like free breakfast and valet parking. That was disappointing butâ€¦

review_text: The location is excellent-Wall street, 9/11 museum, Oculus, and Fulton St subway station are all nearby. The rooms and views are really nice but the real star are the staff!! Jessica is always very helpful and try to accommodate our request for a specific room that we like whenever available and simple things like that just keeps us coming back. The 24/7 concierge may I say is one of the few best ones that we experienced. Just shoot a text when you need something and everyone is ready to deliver. Jessica and Ricky are top notch! Canâ€™t wait to stay again soon! -Butler-Turners

review_text: Arrived at 2 am.  Staff at front desk was very friendly, however, arrived to a room where the TV did not work (noted cable was not connected), darkening drape was hanging partially off the window and in the shower there was dirt and hair in the corner.  Really disappointing experience, particularly given the hotel was notified of the issues on arrival  and arrived back the next day mid-day and nothing was fixed.  Wow I expect more from Marriott's and have never had this kind of issue in the past. I ended up checking out and going to a Conrad Hotel in the area and for almost the same rate had a wonderful Suite with beautiful views of the water.

review_text: We stayed here 3 days over the T-giving holiday.  Great location for easy  5 min. walk to Cortland and Fulton Center subway stations.  Excellent shower and bathroom.   Used pull-out sofa bed but had to call down for linens.  Not in closet.  Downer:  Had an inside room that looked  across to other rooms so kept blinds/drapes.closed.  Felt confined like we were in a closet.  Friendly staff and Excellent Breakfast.  Liked the notice in the elevator describing when best time to eat and avoid crowds.  Never had to ask "what time is it?" due to whimsical clock on the wall.  Wow, who thought of that?

review_text: As per the title - this hotel is in a great location situating at the heart of the financial district of Downtown Manhattan. It is a short 5 minutes walk to World Trade Centre, about 8 minutes walk to Battery Park and less than 3 minutes walk to Fulton Centre where the main lines of the subway stop at. There's an exit/entrance just right beside the hotel though.  Check-in was fast and hassle-free, and I am very impressed with the efficiency of Annabelle. She even takes the initiative to find me a quiet corner which I appreciated her kind gesture. Overall the reception staff are friendly, thus a big thumb up to them!  Room wise, I booked the King bed studio and got a room facing the busy street which can be noisy at a certain time especially if there's police/fire engine soundingâ€¦

review_text: We got a free upgrade to a double Queen suite, room 1804. It was HUGE for a nyc hotel room and perfect for our family of four. Our kids, 9 and 7 like to sleep separately so the 9yr old  got the second queen and the 7yr old slept on the pullout couch in the living room area.  For an adult the mattress on the pullout would have been horrendous (you can feel every spring) but he loved it and reported a great nights sleep.  I would advise asking for the blankets and sheets for the pullout ahead of time- it took about 45mins for them to bring up when we finally thought to ask. And they donâ€™t keep them in the room. Also the blankets they supply for the pullout are thin compared to the bed blankets. I wasnâ€™t a fan of the blankets on the beds- not wide enough for my 6â€™5â€ husband andâ€¦

review_text: I have visited this property several times and have enjoyed it each trip. Great location, excellent value (with big breakfast included) and generous sized rooms for an NYC hotel.  As always cozy comfortable beds and excellent customer service from check in to check out!  On my most recent visit, there was a problem with my billing but Michael the manager promptly and professionally fixed the issue. Then I received a follow up call from the operations manager Eugenia to make sure I was satisfied with the outcome. I truly appreciated their service.  Look forward to seeing them again in coming weeks!

review_text: Went to NYC to meet friends and wanted to be near WTC area. Great walking distance to many great restaurants and attractions. We had the large studio which had plenty of room. The room was clean and bed was very comfortable. The breakfast buffet was decent and they worked hard to keep it clean during the time we attended. Very good coffee and great variety with the juice bar. Price was very reasonable given the location and quality of the hotel. We would definitely stay here again. Front desk was also great as was was the valet service.

review_text: By the end of 2019 we will have spent close to two months at this location (RIWTC). When you spends this long at a hotel, one truly discovers the depth of character and professionalism of its staff. I can truly say that RIWTC staff is like fine wine, it only gets better with age.   Due to a building fire, we were displaced from our nyc home. We spent our first night in a lackluster hotel and moved to RIWTC the very next day. It is a decision that made a very difficult time actually seem pleasant and stress-free. The reasons follow:  *The staff is remembers your name: â€¢When I needed to visit the front desk, I noticed that the associates greeted many people by name, not just our family.  ++Thank you Danielle, Annabelle, Jane, Jessica,   and Miguel.  *The staff pays attention toâ€¦

review_text: The location was perfect for a wedding we were attending. Loved how close it is to battery park so we could get to the Statue of Liberty and very close to WTC as well. We had a slight snafu at check in that delayed us getting into our room late at night. However, they corrected it quickly. The staff was really wonderful: the front desk staff, the bell services. Housekeeping, and the food service/bussers during breakfast were all very nice. The space worked well with our two kiddos and loved having the full fridge and microwave! The option of a tub to bathe our boys would have been a nice touch. Our view, even on the 16th floor, wasnâ€™t very exciting, but it was dark and quiet at night, which we enjoyed.

review_text: Not sure what is the best part, the location, the room, or the staff. To start with, it is just one block away from the Fulton street station which has plenty of subway lines to get around so easily. The room itself was great, even for just the studio, especially the oven. It was a great way to reheat leftover pizza from Eataly (which I could even see out of my window) in an actual convention oven so it got nice and crisp again. On top of that the staff was great at helping me check-in to my rooms and kept a key for a guest arriving after work for me. They even checked up on me each day to see if I needed anything, specifically Eugy and Danille. Much better than anything in times Square and at an even better price.

review_text: I stay at the Residence frequently for work, and it's definitely my preferred hotel in Manhattan. The rooms are surprisingly large for NYC, and always very clean. I like the full bottles of shampoo etc in the shower, and having a fridge is useful for longer stays.  The front desk staff is super nice and friendly - Jessica always remembers me and checks me in super quickly.  I LOVE having a Peloton in the gym - for a small gym, Marriott is really putting in usable amenities.  And, breakfast is pretty good for a large hotel - I appreciate the grab and go items.

review_text: We spend a week here in September 2019 and absolutely loved our experience. The hotel is located just minutes away from WTC, including One World, The Oculus, and the 9/11 Memorial. It is also within walking distance (20 minutes or less) to The Battery, City Hall, Brooklyn Bridge, and Chinatown. While it may seem far away from location like Time Square, Chelsea, Upper East Side, or Upper West Side, the proximity to the subway stations still make it an ideal location.  The hotel itself was a wonderful experience. Residence Inn is usually our hotel of choice for longer vacations because of that home away from home feel and this particular location was no exception to this. The Front Desk staff and the F&B staff are so sweet and accommodating. The hotel provides complimentaryâ€¦

review_text: Stayed here during the heat wave in July 2019. The location is excellent, right next to the World Trade Center and next to many subway stops. Walking distance to Brooklyn bridge was very convenient as well. The room was roomy for a hotel room in manhattan. Enjoyed having a pretty nice gym to work out in instead of attempting to run in the sweltering heat. Free breakfast was a great as well. Couldn't ask for a better hotel for partying in NYC.

review_text: Weâ€™ve just completed a 10 night stay in late August to early September.  The journey from the airport was easy  - get the Airtrain to Howard Beach, and then the A train from Howard Beach to Fulton Street. The exit you need at Fulton Street is either the Broadway & Fulton St Exit which leads into the Fulton Center (walk up the stairs and elevators and turn left at the exit â€“ you will see a GAP about 3 mins later â€“ entrance to the left) or take the exit for Maiden Lane & Broadway which brings you up by the GAP (but will be more stairs and is a further confusing walk within the station). I had read that the hotel was 4 minutes from Fulton Street but didnâ€™t realise that Fulton Street had a myriad of different exits we could take. (At Fulton Street you can get the A, C, J, Z, 2, 3,â€¦

location: The exit you need at Fulton Street is either the Broadway & Fulton St Exit which leads into the Fulton Center (walk up the stairs and elevators and turn left at the exit â€“ you will see a GAP about 3 mins later â€“ entrance to the left) or take the exit for Maiden Lane & Broadway which brings you up by the GAP (but will be more stairs and is a further confusing walk within the station).
other: The journey from the airport was easy  - get the Airtrain to Howard Beach, and then the A train from Howard Beach to Fulton Street. I had read that the hotel was 4 minutes from Fulton Street but didnâ€™t realise that Fulton Street had a myriad of different exits we could take. (At Fulton Street you can get the A, C, J, Z, 2, 3,â€¦

review_text: We recently spent a 3 day weekend here that was booked several months in advance. We've stayed at several other Marriott properties in NYC that we love and wanted to give this location a try. Unfortunately, it didn't compare with the other hotels. I reserved an executive studio King room with sofa bed and a studio queen room. Both rooms faced a dark alley with the neighboring building in such close proximity that you needed to keep the drapes closed for privacy. We were on the 8th and 6th floors so due to the height of the buildings, we couldn't tell if it was sunny or cloudy. Upon check in, we were told their systems were down and they couldn't add our Marriott number into their system (we have Titanium status). Our key cards stopped working the very next day so we went back toâ€¦

review_text: I have nothing bad to say, I loved staying here. It's far enough away from Midtown that you don't have to worry about that crowd, but a short enough subway ride into Midtown that you can get there quickly. The service here was incredible, as well. Every employee was very nice and attentive. I got in early on my check in day after a red eye and they let me check in to use my room before I had to go to a conference. Made my day. I'd definitely stay here again. The breakfast is delicious too. And the rooms are comfortable and spacious, of course!

review_text: We stayed at the Residence Inn New York Downtown Manhattan World Trade Center Area last week and it was excellent. The staff were all super helpful and friendly, the room was well appointed, and the breakfast area was clean, fully stocked and had staff members there to keep everything in order. The WiFi worked well, and the elevators were fast and operated smoothly. This was also the perfect spot to sight see in lower Manhattan. It is located a block from the 9/11 memorial and close to the river walk area with several restaurants close by. The only negative (no the fault of the hotel) was the parking when you arrive and depart. It is on a narrow street and when they brought our car back they had to park in the traffic lane as there was no curb side spots. We had to load quicklyâ€¦

review_text: Conveniently located for downtown and the world trade centre area, this is a fair business hotel. The rooms have been redecorated fairly recently and are of a decent size and are comfortable. The shower was a little dated but adequate.  The staff are extremely friendly and efficient.  The inclusive breakfast is Ok, although it does get crowded.   There is no bar in the hotel, and they do not sell alcohol, although there is a wine shop right next door.  The only negative is the noisy air-con that made two loud clicks every time it started blasting away - which often woke me.

review_text: We stayed here for a weekend, price was right and either a walk or subway ride to anywhere.  It was so quiet at night we could hear the other guests opening their doors to their rooms.  Super clean and rooms are very large.  Full fridge, microwave and dishes.  Bathroom has toiletries and the towels and sheets were very nice.  Comfortable bed.  We arrived at 3 in the morning and it was nice to know that the front door is locked between 11p-6a and you have to ring the desk to get in, after giving them our name they opened the door and then we learned that we can only access the lobby without a room key.  Great to know the hotel is secure.  Breakfast was ok - coffee was great.  We would definitely stay here again.

review_text: My family and I stayed for 11 nights and would thoroughly recommend this hotel. Nice rooms with super comfy beds, big showers and a fully equipped kitchenette with a massive fridge, very useful to store a few 'left-overs' from breakfast. The property is very near to several Subway stations so it's really easy to reach anywhere within the city. Breakfast was much better than we expected, never too busy either, we always found a space. They have a little gym and self-service laundry facilities, which we used several times during our stay there. The best thing about this hotel though are all the people working there! Everybody was very friendly,helpful and professional,  the receptionists, the breakfast staff, the maintenance people and the room attendants. We would definitely stayâ€¦

review_text: We decided to stay here to explore lower Manhattan, the Brooklyn area, and also for a day trip to Coney Island.  Very close to everything and the stay was very comfortable. A tasty breakfast, nice little gym space for a morning HIIT session, then perfect distance for us to take a run across Brooklyn bridge at sunrise one of the highlights of our trip.  Nice jolly staff throughout, stylish decor and pictures and comfortable room, would stay again.

review_text: The location of this hotel is great. Steps away from the Fulton Street Station and WTC area, which has lots of new shops and restaurants. Interior is nice, and we loved the room and views. As with other Residence Inns weâ€™ve stayed at, itâ€™s a real plus to have a kitchenette in the room and features like self service laundry. Highly suggest checking out Eataly over at the Westfield Mall.   Initial staff that checked us in were very warm and welcoming. I appreciate them sending out text messages letting us know our room was ready, and I was impressed when they sent a text the following day asking how our room and stay was.   A few imperfections we encountered: one member of the front desk staff in the evening, a large framed older man, was not very friendly or helpful. We first hadâ€¦

review_text: My family and I stayed at this hotel for a week in July 2019.  We had an executive studio which had a kitchenette (microwave, dishwasher, full size fridge, silverware, dishes, cups and glasses), sofa bed and king bed.  The furnishings were modern and appeared clean.  The bathroom (standing shower, no tub) was clean and nicely furnished.  The hotel provided shampoo, conditioner, body wash and lotion for the bathroom and dishwasher soap and paper towels for the kitchenette.  There was a coffeemaker in the room, though I did not use it.  Pros: location.  The hotel was close to the Fulton and Cortlandt Stations, to which many different Metro trains stop.  You can walk to the 9/11 Memorial and Museum and Wall Street.  You could also walk to Battery Park (but we didn't because it wasâ€¦

review_text: Stayed in July 2019, Tue through Sun morning. Use Residence Inn in California a lot. Room was quite and clean. Missed the stove that Residence Inn generally has. Breakfast was okay but not the Residence Inn Breakfast that I usually experience. The kids wants waffles but no waffle maker here. The area really was too small to handle the hotel's capacity. Space is at a premium I guess but that needs to be considered when designing the property's layout. Access to the 4,5,R,W Subway lines is near by (WTC Station and Fulton Station) so you can get to and from anywhere that you want to go rather quickly.

review_text: We stayed here for a quick weekend trip to New York.  The hotel is in a great spot and near several subway stops like Fulton Center Station, Corlandt Station, and the World Trade Center Station.  This made it extremely easy and convenient to get around.  Also, the hotel was easy to get to from JFK as well, requiring only one transfer from Hamilton Beach Station.   Check-in was easy and we were greeted warmly by Gerry.  He was apologetic about the short wait as there was a bit of a line and he was the only front desk staff on duty.    The hotel room itself was extremely clean and looks to be very recently renovated.  Our room on the 8th floor had a full-sized refrigerator and microwave, as well as a sink and a dishwasher.  We were not here long enough to really take advantage ofâ€¦

review_text: I stayed her with my family over the 4th of July weekend. The rooms are large compared to most hotels we stay at in NY. We had a room with 2 queen beds instead of the 2 double beds we usually get in NYC.  Breakfast is included as it is in all residence inns. They had some pretty healthy options with fresh fruit, yogurt, granola, and eggs whites as well as more standard fair like scrambled eggs, sausage, and bacon. The breakfast room has lots of Starbucks coffee. They post the busy times for breakfast and they are right-on. It gets very busy after 8am.  We usually stay in midtown, so this was a new location for us.  The location was perfect for the fireworks as we could easily walk to both the Macyâ€™s fireworks and the battery park fireworks. This is important as there are a lotâ€¦

review_text: Spent 2 nights at this beautiful hotel! Was greeted by a friendly and accommodating staff. Our room was perfect! We had a great view from the top floor looking out on the beautiful city including a view of one of the 9/11 Memorial Pools. I utilized the gym they have there which had free weights, a bench, a couple Peloton bikes, and an awesome digital workout machine called the Tonal. First time ever using something like that and it was phenomenal. Definitely a plus! The assistant general manager Michael helped us with great recommendations for dinner and things to do around the city. Would highly recommend staying here!!

review_text: Staying in the hotel was wonderful from start to finish. When we arrived the staff was attentive, excited, and willing to help with anything we needed. I stayed in the hotel for my anniversary and it was in a great location. The hotel is located right next to the World Trade Center and has access to pretty much every subway within 3 blocks. Breakfast was good by continental standards. Everything was clean and well organized however it does get a little crowded near the end so the eariler you can wake up the better. The room itself was large, had a good view and was very clean.  I have literally 0 complaints.  10/10 would stay here again.

review_text: This is the second time we have stayed at his hotel. We love the location. Close to great shopping and dining as well as Pace University.  The customer service staff is very accommodating with room requests.  For both stays, we had rooms on a high numbered floor in a quiet area.  The rooms are very clean and the beds are great.  The staff also has provided great dining recommendations in walking distance and by cab. The breakfast was probably the only area that I felt could be better. The utensils were not stocked and the food options were minimal in my opinion.  Still nice to have some sort of breakfast included when you have a busy day ahead so we do appreciate that. This is our goto hotel when visiting lower Manhattan.

review_text: Outstanding stay!!  The location is great for exploring lower Manhattan, our room was big and had a full-size refrigerator, beds are comfortable, and very clean.  The full breakfast was very nice with both hot and cold selections.  The real stars of the show are the employees!!  Jane at the front desk was excellent!  She was helpful and got us checked in early, had our luggage delivered to our room, and provided a bag of ice to get us started.  She also greeted us by name whenever she saw us!  Very impressive considering the volume of guests.  Another stand-out employee was Shaun Johnson that worked the desk on the ground floor.  He stored our luggage for us while we explored the city and then got us a very sweet ride to the airport.  Shaun was so friendly and cordial. Weâ€¦

The gym was small but well equipped, enough for a good workout with weights and cardio. Our last night I expressed to Jessica we had a flight for which weâ€™d have to leave earlier than the opening of bfast. She actually made sure we had a selection of foods ready for us before we left even though the bfast was not open yet. That was the epitome of service and we were so grateful for that over and above gesture. We highly recommend this hotel!

review_text: We went for the long Memorial Day weekend and to celebrate my birthday with my kids and husband.  I have to stay that the front desk staff and concierge were extremely friendly to us and my kids.  We were happy with the room as well, fairly spacious for NYC stay.  The room had a kitchenette, which is so useful when traveling with kids.  The room was super clean and had a spacious counter in the bathroom.  The location of this hotel is conveniently located in downtown NYC, walking distance to One World Observatory and the 9/11 Memorial.  Overall, we enjoyed our stay and plan to come back!

review_text: This hotel was an excellent stay.  The location is one block from the Fulton street station.  So if you're using the subway access to several trains is quick and very easy.  The hotel room was very quiet for staying in a big city.  I have stayed in NYC several times before however this was the most quiet and conducive to sleep.  The hotel was very clean, the room had a decent amount of space for NYC standards.  It had a small sink, fridge and kitchen conveniences.  They served a small breakfast - I didn't get a chance to utilize it.  I would stay here again.

review_text: We chose this hotel as it was close to where we had to travel into Brooklyn. Due to the NHL Playoffs there were no rooms available in Brooklyn, so we opted for lower Manhattan. This is in the financial district about 2 blocks from the World Trade Center.  It is also within 2 blocks of almost every subway line, making travel very easy.  We had to stay here on 2 separate non-consecutive weeks. The staff was wonderful and accommodating, making check-in and check-out very pleasant, quick and easy. They answered all of our needs.  The rooms were on the small side, but not really by New York City standards.  As a Residence Inn it of course had a kitchenette with full size fridge, stove, etc. which was very convenient.  My first room was â€œinteriorâ€ with a view of other buildings acrossâ€¦

review_text: After staying in 2 other supposedly 4 stars and highly rated on Tripadvisor hotels in the area while our apartment was being renovated, we were wary of going to another hotel and being sorely disappointed. From the moment we checked into the lobby to when we finally stepped into our room, we were SO happy to finally find a place to call home (at least temporarily). Like the saying goes, "third time is the charm".  The hotel is clean, the staff members are helpful and polite, and the rooms are well-designed. The windows open, have both blackout shades and roller blinds, and are huge! The high ceilings made the room seem bigger than it really is. The room was quiet and we didn't hear our neighbours.   The location is great - you can get anywhere in Manhattan from the Fulton St.â€¦

review_text: I grew up in NYC and visit frequently, as I have since moved away. This is one of the better hotels I have stayed in recently.   Initially when we checked in, we noticed some issues with the room - small pebbles on the floor as if it wasn't vacuumed well, some hair in the sink, and the glasses in the cabinet were smudged with greasy fingerprints. The room was otherwise clean, so we mentioned this to the front desk and they were incredibly apologetic and promised to have someone go right upstairs to fix it. We were leaving for the evening, but when we returned everything was spotless. So thanks for working to fix that right away! I would not dock a star or any rating points as the issue was resolved so quickly.  The room is a great size for NYC, with plenty of closet/drawerâ€¦

review_text: Had a 5 night stay here with my family. It was a great stay. Jessica was so accomodating and welcoming and had a lovely treat card and gift in our room for my husbands birthday. The room was very spacious . We had 2 double beds a pull out sofa and a kitchen area. Very handy to have fridge microwave etc. The batbroom was spotless. It is a few minutes walk from One world observatory  a little walk will also get you to Staten Island ferry/ wall street/ charging bull. Breakfast was good  got and cold options  starbucks coffee. Wifi was good. Lots of shops around and a McDonald's around the corner. Would stay there again. Only thing i found wrong with it was despite us pulling out the sofa bed into a bed option(there were 5 of us) it wasnt dressed with a sheet and pillows until theâ€¦

review_text: I generally don't love Marriotts because they lack zip, but the location and the roominess makes up for a log.  First, the room was roomy with a galley kitchen, complete with dishwasher. Two queen beds and still room to put your luggage, which is awesome in NY. The lobby is not much, but the staff were very friendly and helpful.   The location, though, was outstanding by my priorities: Eataly's downtown location (less of a zoo than Union Square) is barely two blocks away, Century 21is even closer, and there's a Xi'an Famous Food basically around the corner. It was a short walk to the Brooklyn Bridge and an even shorter walk from the ferry from Brooklyn. The Oculus and Fulton Street stations are just a couple of blocks away, so conveniently located for getting anywhere by subway.â€¦

new_text: I generally don't love Marriotts because they lack zip, but the location and the roominess makes up for a log. First, the room was roomy with a galley kitchen, complete with dishwasher. Two queen beds and still room to put your luggage, which is awesome in NY. The lobby is not much, but the staff were very friendly and helpful. The location, though, was outstanding by my priorities: Eataly's downtown location (less of a zoo than Union Square) is barely two blocks away, Century 21is even closer, and there's a Xi'an Famous Food basically around the corner. It was a short walk to the Brooklyn Bridge and an even shorter walk from the ferry from Brooklyn. The Oculus and Fulton Street stations are just a couple of blocks away, so conveniently located for getting anywhere by subway. â€¦

review_text: I was here for about 2 months on business and honestly wish I could distill and describe all the reasons why I enjoyed my stay so much!   The staff was unparalleled in their service, response time, attentiveness, and just plain friendliness.  The room was spacious, comfortable, and extremely quiet (one of the most quiet NYC hotel rooms I've ever been in.) Breath of fresh air after a day in the city.  The location was wonderful! Found some of my new favorite spots/restaurants in New York just walking around the area.  Whole-heartedly recommend this hotel, you'll be doing yourself a favor by staying here!   Thank you to the Marriott team!

review_text: Rooms are noticeably bigger than your average New York City mid-range hotel.   Big enough that it didn't bother me to be in an interior room with no view.  I never opened the shades.  (The big bright stylish clock made the room feel less claustrophobic.)  Comfortable bed and lots of desk space made it easy to work. It's a Residence Inn so the rooms also have fridges, microwaves, plates, glasses, and silverware.  Breakfast was quite good as well, definitely a notch up from the standard rubbery eggs and "sausage product' that you usually get.  Housekeeping service was a little uneven (coffee packets were not replaced; what's the point of having it if it's only for one day?) but very attentive and courteous at check in.   Staying on Wall Street is not my first choice but thisâ€¦

review_text: Iâ€™ve been going to NYC for 20 years and this is the first time I stayed downtown.  The hotel room was very quiet, much larger than a typical NYC hotel room, and felt a bit homey. Overall, good property

review_text: I chose the hotel for the proximity to the Federal Reserve where I had meetings. The location was literally a block from there so it was perfect for that. It was also very close to the World Trade Center memorial that I wanted to visit - about a 2-3 minute walk. There are tons of great restaurants in the area as well.   The entrance was a bit hidden due to construction scaffolding, but once I spotted it and took the elevator up to the lobby, it was a smooth checkin process. The lobby staff Genco (Genco was ALWAYS there) and Danielle were fantastic and very attentive throughout my stay. Checkin was fast and I was off to my room to settle in in minutes.  The room itself was tiny for a Residence Inn but considering this is Manhattan, it's probably pretty generous. That said, it wasâ€¦

review_text: We stayed here for 5 nights - there were 5 of us in the room on a girls holiday.  The room was spacious - which isnâ€™t the normal for New York!  2 large double beds and a double sofa bed, 2 TVs, kitchen area with full size fridge and microwave and a large bathroom.   The hotel was modern and spotless, house keeping did a fantastic job.   The complimentary breakfast was fantastic - great selection of hot and cold foods - you could ask for a take out box if you were in a rush and wanted to eat on the go. Selection each day included, fruit, cereals, yogurts, croissants, bagels, pain au chocolat and a hot buffet with scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage etc  There was also a Starbucks Machine that was also complimentary with take out cups.  Despite reviews on here saying the queues wereâ€¦

If you drive parking is $60 a day and if you need to go somewhere they will charge you another $60 each time you leave and return. That is OUTRAGEOUS.  Either provide in and out parking for $60 or tell everyone not to drive to their hotel.  Staff was very nice.

review_text: I've stayed at this property on and off for over a year while assigned to NYC for work. My stays are usually at least 4 nights, and this is a perfect property for my needs and expectations. The rooms are definitely more spacious (even the standard rooms) than other nearby hotels and have some features that are great for extended stays and/or travel with family, such as ample drawer and closet space, vanity/counter space in the bathroom, and of course the kitchenette with full-size refrigerator. The included breakfast is consistently decent compared to other free breakfast hotels and the experience for me has been orderly and pleasant almost all the time (which is exceptional).   Additionally, the staff--from front desk to housekeeping to breakfast area and management--haveâ€¦

review_text: Spent three nights at the hotel based on tripadvisor recommendations.  The good: close to subway, and some attractions like the WTC, Staten Island Ferry, Wall Street, Stock Exchange, etc. Large spacious rooms, breakfast and wifi included, kitchenette with full size fridge and microwave.   The room is dated, furniture scratched around the edges but if traveling with children it's perfect as it includes so much.   Staff are extremely nice and friendly. They helped make our stay enjoyable. Shoutout to Eugenia and Daniella. They were wonderful.    The cons: the heater was extremely noisy and we had to keep shutting it off because it kept us awake. Beds and shower are mediocre. Nothing great but nothing bad. Just average. Not very many affordable restaurants closeby although they doâ€¦

review_text: Beautifully appointed rooms with small kitchenette and lovely bathroom. You could not possibly complain about the room it was clean and modern : the bathroom as well as bedroom were very sophisticated. The location is great too as you are a stones throw away from 9/11, one world & oculus, Brooklyn bridge, staten island ferry and Statue of Liberty etc. The connection to Uptown is via Fulton Street with the express it takes 5 odd minutes to Grand Central. One can also use the travel hub at the oculus. It seemed an excellent location and real value for money. The only gripe I had was breakfast. The room had a distinct canteen feel to it. There was not enough staff around and people had to put their own plates away. There was a good choice on offer for a quick breakfast and weâ€¦

review_text: The location is excellent if you are visiting the WTC/downtown area with easy access to several subway lines and plenty of walking distance options for food and things to do. The room was very nice with an easy early check-in. The only concern was the level of service at the breakfast. The coffee machine is extremely slow and led to long lines to get a simple cup of coffee and several of the items in the breakfast buffet were not kept stocked. Even with those shortcomings, would visit again.

review_text: My husband and I decided to go to NYC for our birthday celebrations. We wanted to be close to Fulton St. and the 911 Museum and the Residence Inn was the perfect place. Unfortunately for us, it was bitterly cold so we didn't want to walk too far for dinner. Michael at the front desk recommended The Malt House across the street and it was amazing! The 911 Museum was just up the street. If you've haven't been, it's a must. There is so much to do in the general vicinity, that one night doesn't seem long enough. We can't wait to go back again in the spring so we can walk around and take it all in!

review_text: 7 of us traveled to NYC last April and stayed at the Residence Inn which is very near the subway (we took it everywhere!) and many attractions in lower Manhattan.  We reserved two of the larger suites that each included a small seating area and kitchenette. Plenty of space and amenities for our group. Breakfast choices worked for us. I read other reviews about the limited space in the breakfast area but that was not a problem for us. All in all I highly recommend this hotel and would be happy to return!

review_text: Had a wonderful upper floor suite with two queen beds and a separate room with kitchenette and living room. Took advantage of the breakfast each morning, which had wonderful pastries as well as fruit, hot food and make your own waffles.  Desk staff was always helpful to address any questions we had.  Would recommend this if wanting to spend time visiting sites down in the World Trade Center and Statue of Liberty sites.   Also very convenient to subway.

Would have been happy to stay here for more than 1 night and would definitely stay here again.

review_text: My family and I have stayed here several times over the past three years, and it continues to shine.  You canâ€™t beat the location: steps to great dining, sightseeing and entertainment options, and the Subway will take you anywhere worth going in the five boroughs.  I am a native New Yorker, now living elsewhere, and this is our home away from home when visiting friends and family in the area.  The rooms are small; welcome to New York.  Having the efficiency kitchen and grocery options nearby allows some flexibility, and you wonâ€™t find a bigger room at this price point anyway.  Free breakfast is the usual Residence Inn style, but the room is small so get there early or prepare to be patient.  The staff is great, the rooms are fresh, though one complaint is the giant clocks thatâ€¦

review_text: We found every aspect of this hotel to be completely satisfying. From the moment we called ahead from the Jersey Turnpike where we were treated kindly and professionally to when we pulled up outside and Sean helped us with parking and directing us upstairs to check -in which was quick and pleasant.  I wish I remembered the very kind lady at the front desk who welcomed us by name as she had anticipated our arrival.  Again, a seamless process. Elevators were lightning fast, the room perfectly sized and suited us beautifully.  Many thanks to the staff and especially to Sean who was a great help to us!

review_text: Our family of 5 stayed in a fairly spacious and spotlessly clean apartment. The location was terrific and had very easy access to the subway and walking distance to world trade Centre and Battery Park.   We stayed over New Years Eve and it seemed the hotel was at capacity. The customer service was disinterested to say the least. The most appalling incident was when we phoned down to ask for bed linen for the pullout lounge for the fifth person on our reservation and were told the hotel had run out of blankets and would it be ok for them to give us extra sheets. After telling them this was unacceptable they did eventually find blankets.   The breakfast was chaotic and often basic ingredients were out of stock. On two days there were bagels but no cream cheese or butter. When weâ€¦

review_text: The Residence Inn New York Downtown World Trade Center is the perfect spot for visiting the museum, shopping and eating at wonderful restaurants, in particular, Etaly! The location is great, you can travel uptown by express, we did some plays, and back downtown in no time at all. This will be our go to hotel when we visit Manhattan again!!

review_text: I am a seasoned traveler who is on the road for half the year.  I have been fortunate to have had plenty of positive experiences, but some start apart. The service & care I received at the Residence Inn World Trade is simply top notch.  From the moment I arrived all my pre check in requests were done.  The staff greeted me with a smile & went beyond the call of duty to answer every single question.    I can tell the difference when folks are passionate & truly care, the staff at RI  is truly  passionate about their guests.  They even checked on me to make sure I have what needed & that they are at my disposal, simply a 5 star experience!  A special thank you to Danielle, she was simply amazing & made all the difference - I wish every hotel had a Danielle.  Definitely wouldâ€¦

review_text: You'd think, in the heart of Manhattan, this place would be tiny like a NY apt. But it's huge. The room was clean and comfortable. It's kind of weird with the lobby above the ground floor, but I guess that's how they gain space. It was quiet, around New Year, but close to a lot of stuff, like the very nice bar across the street.

review_text: Our family decided to take a last minute trip to New York to celebrate New Year's Eve. With the trip being so close to the holiday, several hotels were already booked or had extremely inflated pricing. We were able to secure the Residence Inn via the actual hotel website and not on a 3rd party link. The price was actually less than booking through a 3rd party site. Upon our arrival, the staff was IMMEDIATELY attentive and helpful. We had our car valeted and there was never a worry of safety or theft. The front desk staff went above and beyond offering us free beverages, extra amenities and even sent personalized text messages to ask how our stay was. The breakfast menu was impeccable and the coffee was amazing! Upon checking out, we wanted to do a little more sightseeing beforeâ€¦

review_text: I love Residence Inn properties. This is my 3rd time and despite the fact of the size of the room as I am used to bigger rooms in other cities, I was very happy with this hotel.  We had a nice view of Fulton Street and we were on a quiet floor ( 6th).  The bed was very comfy and soft--- we had the best sleep-- I couldn't ask for anything better. The bathrooms are nice and stocked with Lemon and Sage toiletries--- the body wash is HEAVEN.  Customer Service is nice especially the breakfast staff very accommodating. I wish there was more breakfast options and more equipment in the gym--- but regardless the hotel is great which is why it still received 5 stars. It's near trains, shopping, etc.  We will definitely come back.

review_text: Second time staying at the Residence Inn. During this particular stay, the room I was booked into was not 100% clean. I typically do not have many needs when it comes to the type of room I stay in, but having it clean is one need for sure. Floor was sticky,  food still in kitchen trash can, dirty fingerprints on surfaces etc.   When I went down to front desk to let them know, Jane was immediately extremely apologetic and told me there have been issues with housecleaning since the recent change in management. Her candor and concern about my stay/experience was  more than apparent, and her efforts in correcting the issue went above and beyond my expectations.  She insisted in upgrading me to a corner room, on a higher floor. Not only did she personally check the new room with meâ€¦

review_text: We stayed 4 nights in late October on our first visit to NYC.  we arrived before check in and were offered a Double Queen room.  The room was modern, clean and well appointed.  The kitchenette was nice, but we didn't make use of it except the fridge, as finding groceries in NYC seems complicated.  And why bother when there are so many food choices nearby.  Easy walking distance to Battery Park and Coney Island Ferry, World Trade Memorial and Brooklyn Bridge.  The subway station is closer than expected and makes for an easy 20 minute ride uptown.    Only went to breakfast one morning and found it to be busy, but well kept, with the usual selections.  After a day of exploring the city, really enjoyed relaxing in the room watching HBO Go, or Netflix on the smart tv.    Our room wasâ€¦

review_text: We stayed for a week over Christmas and this was a great base, close to several subway lines. The beds were fantastic and it was super quiet especially for NYC. We were in room 702 and didnâ€™t hear any noise from the street or the nearby rooms. It was great to have the kitchenette and breakfast included however on several days there was no food available at breakfast, the hotel was full and they seemed unable to cope. The staff on reception were great but the staff on the ground floor entrance were unfriendly and disinterested. Overall a really good experience and I would return.

review_text: This is my second booking at this terrific hotel but this time, due to an unforeseen complication, I had to Cancel. Marriott central reservations were less than useless- so I went to the hotel directly. The helpful and professional service provided to me by Genco at reception and the hotel manager immediately reminded me why I had chosen to book there in the first place- they could not have been more helpful. I have stayed in many, many hotels throughout the world , including a vast range of 5 star chain and independent hotels and Iâ€™m yet to experience more personable service. I thoroughly reccomend this hidden gem in downtown NY. In future this will be the only place I will stay when visiting the city.

review_text: We stayed in NY for 10 days and wanted to have a hotel with basic kitchenette facilities in the rooms so we didn't have to eat out all the time.  This hotel has a large fridge/freezer, microwave/oven, kitchen sink, coffee machine, toaster and the option of a hot plate too.  It was easy to cook good food.  The hotel has complimentary breakfast which is fairly good with various bakery items like bagels, waffles, yoghurt and a selection of hot foods (usually non vegetarian).  So it's east to have only one meal out.  The hotel is very convenient for the metro with almost a dozen lines running through Fulton Street station which is just 2 minutes from the hotel.  There are loads of shopping options within minutes' walk too such as a large upmarket Westfield mall, Century 21, Targetâ€¦

review_text: The staff were great, and were responsive to our requests. We had two rooms, one room was missing some toiletries. The speciation requests in the app were also not completed upon checkin (extra pillows).  It was not a big deal, the front desk sent someone up, though they did not bring up a hand soap. They brought up the giant pump bottles of shower liquids instead. The room seemed to have been renovated since the windows were misaligned. Overall a good stay. Being able to text the front desk was a great option for convenience. I was able to order replacement items while on the road. If I wanted, they could have delivered while we were out. Missing toiletries were a minor inconvenience. The room was however very quiet which was nice. The shower was great, good pressure and niceâ€¦

review_text: What an amazing hospitable stay. From the moment we checked in Annabelle was there to assist us, personable, professional and friendly. We booked here because of the king size bed, the room was clean comfortable and larger than most downtown locations. The breakfast area was bustling in the morning, but the options were abundant and the company was great, there was a lot of group seating, as well as Starbucks coffee machines. Ricky, who works in the breakfast room is a breath of fresh air, what a happy spirit with a zest for life and a keen sense of guest service. I look forward to my next stay, downtown, close to WTC shops and restaurants without the evening crowds. Thank you Marriott for providing a stellar group of professionals to represent this location.

review_text: Really enjoyed our stay for a quick trip to NYC for Christmas festivities. The location is a bit south, but the Fulton St. subway station made things rather easy in terms of getting uptown and then back to the hotel at the end of the night. No issues with the elevators or breakfast. Room was bigger than I was expecting for Manhattan. All in all a great experience.

Would highly recommend.

review_text: Fact of the matter is, the staff members "bend over backwards" for their guests. Myself and several coworkers stay here long term off and on throughout the year and are constantly witnessing the quick and emphatic staff tending to their guests needs, myself included.  Not only is there great staff at this hotel, but the location is only 2 blocks from freedom tower and the 9/11 memorial. There's pubs and shopping all around the area. Only 1 block away from Fulton Station, which is convenient to catch almost any metro line.

review_text: Typically, when I visit New York, I expect a slightly lower quality for the price due to the wear and tear from the volume of guests. However this residence inn pleasantly surprised me. The staff are extremely courteous and helpful here. Annabelle went above and beyond to help us, and we had a fantastic experience with this hotel.  The room is quite a bit cozier than typical residence inns considering the space limitations in New York, but we mostly spent time out in the city. We were conveniently close to the Fulton station and not far from a lot of shops and food. We would stay here again next time we visit to explore the city again!

review_text: I so wanted to love this property - location is excellent, rooms are nice, staff is friendly. They just can't seem to make it all work though. The breakfast situation is appalling - understaffed and so crowded. Yesterday (a Sunday) I gave up on trying to get anything because there were no cups, no coffee in the dispensers, no plates, and no eggs. A whole lot of dirty stuff scattered around and lines of guests waiting for something (anything!) to appear from the back room. Clearly they need more help. Only two people to service breakfast for the entire hotel?? Come on, folks. I see feedback from July 13 on your website where someone named Anca promised to fix this issue for the guest. Six months later and same issue? Then, the laundry room is protected like Fort Knox - you needâ€¦

review_text: This hotel is in an excellent location between 8th and 9th Avenues and we were able to get a king room at a great rate. The rooms have mini-kitchens with a fridge, microwave, and coffee maker. (We stayed at the Marriott Marquis once, paid a ton more, and the room had nothing, not even a coffee maker!) This Homewood Suites room had great air quality and a fan above the bed. Clean washroom and shower. The hotel offers a breakfast option that I imagine is even better when there isn't a pandemic. Coffee, tea, or hot chocolate is available all day.  Also, I really appreciate the self-serve laundry facilities; ALL hotels should offer guests this option. BONUS: You can go to the hotel's wonderful rooftop with your own bevvy at night. What a terrific way to meet new people!

review_text: Our experience with this hotel couldnâ€™t have been better! Nice, friendly staff. Clean, well-equipped room. Very nice hot breakfast. Great location. Discounted parking at garage across the street. Great experience.   They let us check in to our room at 1:15 on a Saturday. We were pleasantly surprised by the size of our King room. It was equipped with microwave, coffee maker, fridge (not mini), stove, and dishwasher. Also stocked with pots, pans, dishes, etc. We werenâ€™t there long enough to cook, but great option for longer stays.   Gym is very nice and the rooftop has lovely seating areas to hang out.   We will gladly be back.

review_text: I had a reservation for the weekend of January 28th 2022 for a business meeting. This was the weekend of the huge east coast snowstorm. The Friday morning of January 28th my meeting was cancelled due to the huge snowstorm. I immediately called the hotel to cancel and spoke with both the operations manager, Nick, as well as the hotel manager, John. They offered a 50% return of my money because it was the day of arrival. I tried to explain that the storm is currently in progress, my meeting was canceled because of the storm and there is no reason for me to travel up I95 from Pennsylvania in the storm. Needless to say, both were quite smug and stated they needed to defer their costs and they would not issue a full refund. As a decades long Hilton Honors member, AMEX Hiltonâ€¦

The breakfasts are okay, but still a very comfy option to go for! The rooms, due to COVID, arenâ€™t cleaned unless you ask and we have to ask for new towels and amenities every once in a while. review_text: Recently visited NYC to accompany a family member to see a specialist at Mt. Sinai Hospital. I called ahead of our trip to explain our situation as I was concerned about traveling due to COVID. A very kind and empathetic front desk agent explained to me all the pandemic protocols that were in place, and assured me that our room would be sanitized and ready for our arrival. We were warmly greeted the moment we entered the lobby, and subsequently checked into an incredibly immaculate and very comfortable room. Our entire stay was flawless, the staff is uniformly kind, efficient, and courteous. The hotel itself is remarkably quiet and conveniently located. All the common areas such as the lobby, elevators, and dining area were very clean. The complimentary breakfast had a greatâ€¦

review_text: Booked a room for Monday, December 27th.  Was planning on being in town for a Broadway show.  The show was cancelled on Friday, December 24th.   I called the hotel the next morning, they said they couldn't help me because I had an Advanced Purchase reservation--which apparently means no changes could be made by the hotel.  They said I'd have to talk to the Advanced Purchase team, but that they only take calls Monday-Friday.  When I called back Monday to talk with the Advanced Purchase team on Monday, they said since I was calling on the date of the reservation there was nothing they could do.   The Hilton rep said they were open for calls on Sat/Sun even though the front desk rep had told me they weren't. It's very frustrating.  I bought a $672 ticket, and Hilton was unwillingâ€¦

review_text: Stayed here from 9th - 13th Jan and then again checked in again on the 14th after a short trip out of NYC. The On-App Check-In worked amazingly well, the room was ready even before I arrived and I got to pick my room on the app from my cab. The staff is amazingly polite and helpful. Had a small issue with the house keeping but the on-duty manager, Mr Dontavius resolved the issue immediately. He even came up to my room to personally check the issue.  Mr Dontavius and Mr Henry at the check in desk are doing an amazing job keeping the guest happy. The room was clean, spacious with a complete kitchen.   Breakfast surprisingly  amazing considering the other hotels are just maximizing the profits under the garb of pandemic restrictions. Very Very well located on 37th, which is likeâ€¦

review_text: Aloha NYC!! This hotel is a must stay for so many reasons. The hotel is spotless is clean. They use every precaution to keep you safe during your stay. Your room has a full bathroom & kitchen. If you are so lucky to get to know the staff like I did like Samir, Miguel & the entire front desk you will be thankful. As well as Kayla & Kevin in sales just super down to earth people. There is no other hotel I will every stay in NYC. They made me feel as I was at home.

The view from my room on the 17th floor was absolutely beautiful & I never had to wait too long for an elevator so it was great. review_text: Iâ€™ve been coming to this hotel for years but it has really gone downhill. Lots of homeless out front and staff that does not seem to care.  We had to file multiple complaints with the front desk because of all the noise the cleaning crew was making at all hours of the day AND night.  Constant banging because they would clean with the door security lock in place and every time they went into the room which was 20 to 30 times per room you would hear loud banging noises as the door would slam shut.  There was also constant yelling in the hallways, and if you wanted to walk to your room you would have to walk over piles of used towels and bed linens which were stacked in the hallways. review_text: The hotel is at a great location in Midtown. The reviews about homeless people outside the hotel and marijuana smell are spot on. For proximity to good metro lines and Times Square it is good. The rooms are decent sized and the shower has good water pressure. The breakfast has a huge variety and there is coffee and tea available 24/7. The room could have been a bit cleaner as there were hairs in the drawers which made it feel slightly grimy.  I would recommend this for location but, if walking past homeless people to get into your hotel is a problem for you -you might want to look elsewhere.

review_text: Stayed for a long weekend with my son. The location is excellent, basically half-way between Penn Station and Broadway. Itâ€™s a beautiful, clean property. We love the room. I should emphasize all rooms have a fully functioning kitchenette. We upgraded from a normal studio to a one-bedroom, and we feel like we were the King of NY.  We also love the 2nd floor view of the street. In the post-covid era, this is one of the best breakfast buffets I've seen, and the 24-hour coffee/tea is most appreciated. There are two individuals who deserve special recognition. We have some special needs, and Miguel went way above and beyond to meet and exceed our expectations there. On our last day, we had some travel complications, and Samir came to our rescue.

review_text: For being on the cheapest side of commercial Manhattan hotels, this property is great. After all taxes/fees, we avg $265/night for an upgraded â€œclean airâ€ room which I did think the air was cleaner than your avg hotel room, basic but nice staff, large rooms (for NYC), good gym, on-site laundry ($7 per load), free breakfast, kitchens in room, free wifi, free snacks/water ($15/day), I think this is a great value and I would certainly stay here again. review_text: Just had a wonderful Hilton experience at the Homewood Suites Times Square on West 37th Street in NYC. Wait, what?  Wonderful and Homewood and NYC in the same sentence?  Yes. *** Due to some safety issues, I had to vacate my 92 year old mom from her NYC apartment and find us two adjoining rooms for a few nights.  I needed kitchenettes, comfort, clean and easy.  Called the Hilton Diamond Desk and they found us this property. But they went one better and called the Manager to ask him to preblock adjoining rooms. When I arrived, the Front Desk said no way. I asked them to check the notes and BOOM there it was - two adjoining rooms blocked off. â€œYou hit the jackpotâ€, the Front Desk said.  Rooms were spotless and super quiet.  Perfect kitchenette, great bathroom and fluffy towels.â€¦

review_text: Central location. The customer service at Homewood Suites NYC Midtown Manhattan is superior. Idris, Henry, and Samir greeted us upon our arrival and helped us several times throughout our 4 night stay. I was able to check in earlier than anticipated. After a long flight and lugging our luggage through Manhattan, I could have just hugged each of them for getting us our room to relax for a bit before hitting the sights!  A free breakfast is always appreciated. Felix, Lizbeth, and Ana were great hostesses. Anytime we were done, they cleared the plates and always provided assistance with getting us condiments, etc.   Beds were comfy, room was large, and the fitness center has a lot of options and is large. The upper floor patio available to all is a quiet oasis from the busy streetâ€¦

review_text: We arrived at the Hotel at about 2pm completely exhausted. We were hoping to get a room before the Check.in time of 4pm. The gentleman at the reception told us politely in a distant tone that we had to wait till 4pm, but was gracious enough to put my food items that required refrigeration into the freezer. At about 10 minutes to 4pm  and asked if our room was ready and he said yes. Was wondering why he had to wait for us to ask. He could have just beckoned on us  especially when he knew we were keen to get into the room as early as possible.  Overall, the staff are extremely polite and helpful, but need to make guests a lot morn welcome by looking less stern

review_text: We are having work done on our apartment in midtown this weekend and  for another long weekend in October. We booked this hotel both stays as we had stayed here a few years ago and it was lovely. It was spotless then and very clean. Almost $800 for two nights and our room is not Hilton quality. I travel a lot and expect to clean a hotel room a little when I get there - I usually have to wipe a few things down and I always check for bedbugs. The box spring is torn to shreds as if they had searched with reason and that makes me very nervous. The shades are ripped and tattered. The couch is stained. The furniture is chipped, the trash can which can easily be replaced is falling apart and filthy. The room was very dirty and had splashes and fingerprints everywhere. There was a dirtyâ€¦
