review_text: From the moment I booked my reservation, I was treated with outstanding customer service and even being in a busy city such as Manhattan, the response time was astonishing. I have to shout out Samir at the front desk who really was my go to person during my stay. Through the Hilton app and in person, he was not only extremely helpful but quick, knowledgeable, and always professional. The entire staff was a true example of divine customer service, attending to multiple guests at once while always remaining professional. The hotel was updated, extremely clean, and the facilities were all top notch. This hotel is a gem in such a crazy city. Will definitely be staying here again.

As a result of their incompetence, my 20 yr old son had to spend four nights on the absolute worst sofa â€œbedâ€ I have ever seen.   Nick, who is apparently their Director of Operations was rude and unprofessional.  In all my years as a Hilton Honors member I have never encountered such treatment. review_text: Wanted to give a shout out to the staff at Homewood suites for making our 2 week stay pleasurable. We chose this hotel as we wanted to be at a great location, as well as wanting a kitchenette with a microwave, refrigerator and laundry.  There are very few in New York to begin with. Itâ€™s a very clean hotel that serves up a generous breakfast. The lobby and outdoor seating areas are plentiful. There is plenty of attention to immaculate house keeping thanks to Lenny and her staff. The hotel is constantly cleaned including the pavement that is powerwashed frequently.  I would definitely staying here in the future and would strongly recommend this place to anyone looking for a comfortable stay

review_text: Oh, my. Who would think that  you could fall in love with a mattress, a pillow, bed linens? Part of it was probably the dozen miles we walked before crumbling, but seriously, we wanted to take it all with us. Great experience from check in to check out. Staff were polished professionals who put us at ease and anticipated our every need. Comfortable, spacious room and the hotel itself offers guests two brilliant outdoor features including a rooftop filled with hydrangeas. We come to the city twice a year on business and we have found our new home in Homewood Suites. Loved our stay.

review_text: This hotel is as BUSY as they come, but the staff and the manager on duty were all accommodating and tried their best to work with all their guests to get us situated our respective rooms.   The rooms were clean and had all the amenities needed for my vacation including a fridge, cooktop, microwave, coffeemaker, couch with pull out bed, and a nice clean bathroom  The hotelâ€™s location is near Time Square, which was a bit too busy for my taste (my fault for not checking), but if youâ€™re into this type of touristy accommodations this is the place to stay. Big bonus is that itâ€™s three short blocks away from Penn Station.   Would I stay here again? Yes, definitely would.

review_text: This hotel has friendly and helpful staff. It is also a very clean hotel room and public area. The room for New york city is a decent size we had a suite with a mid-size refrigerator microwave sink and more. The bed was very comfortable tV was fine. The bathroom was clean and average size, the shower had hot water. The elevators were quick and you could tell which one was coming. They also had a nice rooftop area you could sit and relax. They also had a very good breakfast in a very nice and clean area. They had both hot and cold selections and to-go boxes if you wanted to eat in your room. They had 24-hour coffee and tea and it was hot. If I had to complain about something if would be they had turkey bacon, not regular bacon. I would absolutely stay there again.

review_text: This hotel is in a great location to walk or ride anywhere in NYC! *parking garage nearby.  The staff at the front desk was  so kind and helpful, especially Samir as we left a few things behind and he retrieved them for us:-) The rooms are a nice size and have a full kitchen.  Full breakfast each morning and for a nice time period.  The rooftop deck is the best feature to finish off each evening after touring the city.  We will surely stay here again when we return to NYC!

review_text: This was the the second time our family spent a week in New York City and we absolutely loved this hotel! The hotel is beautiful and in a great location. The room is large for NYC, everything was sparkling clean and so nice!. We had a very comfortable bed and equally comfortable sofa bed - amazing!  The sound insulation was fantastic, we really enjoyed the peace and quiet in the room. The kitchenette was so useful for our family, and we especially loved the full refrigerator. The morning buffet breakfast was excellent and varied every day, great way to start the day! We loved that there was an outdoor patio to have breakfast, it made us feel so safe! I want to give a special thanks to Ellie, who was so kind and helpful when I realized, after returning home, that I had leftâ€¦

review_text: My boyfriend and I wanted a change of scenery with working remotely and decided to head to New York and stay at the Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown ManhattanÂ - and it was a 5-star experience!! The staff was very accommodating, especially JL who helped me find a quiet place to work ( video zoom meeting)Â  when the business center was fully taken.Â This hotel is a steal for the price! Great location, easy to get anywhere in the city by walking or taking the metro which is a block away. The hotel has a gym, a full kitchen in your room, a free breakfast and it does not disappoint - fresh eggs/omelet, steak/turkey sausage, hashbrowns/potatoes, oatmeal, and the normal continental.Â All the workers are so friendly and greet everyone as they come into the hotel and walk aroundâ€¦

review_text: This was one of my worst hotel stays ever and I travel a lot. The room was not ready on arrival (a few minutes after check in time) and had to wait in the lobby with many others waiting for their rooms as well for over an hour. Room reserved on line was not the room given despite having the confirmation for the different room type. Others in the lobby were having the same issue and the hotel was absolutely no help and took no responsibility, basically saying too bad! The room was dirty with dust and crumbs behind the bed! The bedding was made up of two sheets and something that resembled a duvet with no cover that had stains! Bathroom lights flickered when hair dryer was used! Ants on the table in the room! Plugs under the bedside stand so you have to crawl under it to plug inâ€¦

review_text: I just returned from New York where I stayed at the Homewood Suites Midtown Manhattan/Times Square South. I had reserved one of their oversized rooms, because I was traveling with my sister and my two grown children, and I had stayed in the oversized room before and found it to have plenty of room to spread out. We arrived right at check-in time and were told that our room had not yet been cleaned. We waited in the lobby for over an hour before it was ready. When we got to the room, it was tiny--not the room I had reserved. When I told the front desk staff, they first insisted that this was the room I had booked. After I produced my original confirmation email showing that the room I reserved was the description of the oversized room, the manager blamed the error on the bookingâ€¦

review_text: I did lots of research before choosing the Homewood Suites. The 8th floor King Room with Terrace was what sold me.  The room was great and roomy. Everything you needed was there. Mini kitchen with dishes and cookware.  It was very clean and we checked in early without fuss from the front desk.  Buffet breakfast was free and had a variety of foods.  The terrace is wide so you have no fear of heights while on it and you can enjoy being outside and have privacy which in New York is rare.

review_text: Positive - The rooms themselves are nice. The rooftop area is good with a better than average view (even the Hudson can be seen at a distance). The elevators are fast (a little too fast). The location is convenient to walk to the Penn station as well as Times Square from. There are many restaurants on the 8th and 9th avenue.   There were serious negatives.  1. Check in and points issues - even after checking in the morning of the PREVIOUS day, and stating what time weâ€™ll arrive, the room was not ready. After an hour of waiting, the room was still not ready. They offered me 5000 points as an apology. I accepted that and it appears on my points statement. But after yet another hour, the room was still not ready. They offered another 5000 points (total 10000). I have NOT receivedâ€¦

review_text: Hotel rooms (with their mini kitchen) and staff are welcoming and nice. However, this hotel needs to do something about the weed problem and the people who come in off the street who obviously aren't guests. Perhaps they need a doorman who checks room keys upon entry and knows who is coming in and out. Also, pillows suck, bring your own.  The hotel isn't located in the best area. There are people constantly hanging out on the street smoking weed, sleeping, loitering, etc. My husband and I were convinced many of the people in the lobby weren't even staying at the hotel. One day, we sat in the lobby to eat lunch and saw a man just outside rolling a blunt. Prior to that, the same man was inside the lobby seating area blasting explicit music on his phone with no regard for thoseâ€¦

Lots of garbage outside the hotel entrance.

I hope this gets better soon. We haven't eaten dinner yet, and are not able to because we have nowhere to keep our luggage. We were looking forward to this trip. I have just graduated college as an RN and this was supposed to be my special graduation trip. Definitely unsatisfied with how the stay is going so far and we haven't even gotten the room yet!

review_text: Was hesitant to book due to uneven reviews, but I like this hotel for being fully functional in the basics.  The thermostat functioned expertly between heat and cool.  The TV offered wide variety of channels and remote easy to use.  Wifi was flawless. Elevator wait not an issue. Bathroom shower great, toilet flushed vigorously and fast.  Bed mattress ave comfort. Must schedule housekeeping. Breakfast average. Balcony more of a patio and fun but needed more attention to plantings. Room quiet.  There is a noticeable presence of apparent homeless in streets but not inside. Key security.  I am hard to please since I used to travel for work all the time, but was happy.  The desk answers the phone all the time promptly. I had a smoke alarm beeping but they fixed it almost immediately.â€¦

review_text: I like the Homewood Suites line of hotels but this one was a disappointment. I was in room 1205. It needed a good cleaning. Splashes of old whatever on the walls and dusty dirty corners and floors. The complimentary breakfast was BAD. Went down at 9, 1.5 hours before breakfast ended and everything was empty. I mean EVERYTHING. All four hot items were empty, forks were gone, bread was gone. I stood around looking for someone to refill for a good 10 min before someone came out of the back and started checking things. It wasnâ€™t super busy either so I donâ€™t know what the excuse was. Also the area the hotel is in is sketchy. Even for NYC. Itâ€™s close to Penn station and several subway line but I would stay further north next time.

review_text: First trip anywhere for over a year and I stay for 3 weeks in NYC as it wakes up (both normal Spring awakening and post Covid awakening).  There were a great many things I appreciated about the hotel. First I will address the couple of items that are less than perfect.  The breakfast offerings were highly variable and limited. Some kind of posted menu of what to expect would have been preferred.  The street the hotel is located in is not good. The hotel does a good job of keeping the problems out of the lobby. For reference I often stay in the lower east side and there I appreciate the chaos and blending of cultures. On this street it wasn't 'interesting' it was 'nasty'.  Ok bad stuff out of the way. On to the good stuff and there is plenty.  Food delivery - very much sortedâ€¦

review_text: The room we were given was not up to par. The phone in the room was broken, the electrical socket where the coffee maker was plugged in did not work, there was no iron in the room, our requests to be brought towels and toiletries were forgotten 3 times causing us to eventually have to go down and get it ourselves. We asked for an iron on Friday night and did not receive one until Sunday when we eventually went down and got it ourselves. The ceiling fan in the room was caked in dirt causing my allergies to flare up. For a Hilton property this was very disappointing. Please take better care of your rooms. The property is already not in the best of areas so making sure the rooms are taken care of is a must.

review_text: This hotel was nice, but nothing that truly sticks out that is worth commending.  I will add that the bed lamps in the room are positioned horribly right over the head of the bed.  It was a family trip and as such, we got the 2 queen bed rooms on the 18th floor.  Both my husband and my younger son hit their head on those lamps twice.  The only way to avoid it is if they slept further down the bed and moved their pillow away from the headboard.   Definitely something the hotel should look into- as those metal lamps can really hurt!

review_text: I checked in right away. The gentleman at the front desk was very nice. The hotel in general is very nice, but some of the people staying there (because of the pandemic, I heard homeless people were being housed there), there was a smell of weed everywhere! So the guests ranged everywhere from bougie international travelers to really sketchy people. But I assure you, you will feel safe.  If there are sketchy people, for the most part, they keep to themselves.    The rooms are nice, and actually the pictures on here don't do it justice. They're fairly roomy (for NY hotels) and the kitchenettes are complete with dishes, flatware, pans, etc. But, there are no knives, just butter knives. There's also a full fridge, dishwasher, hot surface, and microwave.    The shower is nice withâ€¦

review_text: We live 20 miles North of NYC and wanted a quick getaway and to support the local economy.  Upon arrival (4pm) we found out the room we reserved via app check-in was no longer available and had to wait at check-in for 15 minutes.  We had spent the day walking the city on a cold day and was ready for a hot shower.  Unfortunately we were bumped to a room with no towels and had to wait hours to get the towels at 8pm.  The toilet was also clogged but apparently there was no maintenance person working, a security member eventually came with a plunger.   Later at bed time we found out the sofa bed didn't have any linens.  We tried calling but was constantly put on hold.  Frustrated I went to the front desk and spoke with the attendant to find out there was no linens or blankets. â€¦

review_text: First time visiting NY with my family and I have to say that regarding our stay at this Homewood location it made it easier for us to get around the points of interest we wanted to visit like the Statue of liberty, The 9/11 memorial,th Maddison Square Garden,the Brooklyn bridge just name a few. It only took us 5mnts walk to Penn Station if you planning to move around by train its an excellent area.  The staff members were very nice and very helpful specially  Audreen, at the front desk she went above and beyond to help us with whatever we need it in our 3 nights stay. Rooms are very spacious and clean, breakfast was very good. The only thing that I did not like its their policy of not having houskeeping service unless you stay 5 nights or more. However we did enjoy our stay andâ€¦

review_text: Stayed One Night,1/7/21 With My Wife For A Birthday Celebration.Great Room W/Kitchenette.Friendly Staff. Affordable Parking Across The Street, Paid $45.00 For Suv For 24 Hours. Unfortunately Homeless Are Staying At Hotel 2 Doors Down And Upon Arrival There Was A Homeless Family Checking In To The Hotel. One Family Member Was Clearly On Drugs And There Was Also A Transvestite Hanging Out In Lobby. Later In The Evening We Went To 22Nd Floor Rooftop Area And There Was A Young Lady Getting High. The Area Surrounding The Hotel Is Sketchy At Best. We Were Told By Staff To Be Careful At Night Walking By The Surrounding Area Of The Hotel. We Did Some Research Later And Found Out That Right Now 20% Of All Manhattan Hotels Are Acting As Homeless Shelters And The Worst Area Is The Midtownâ€¦

review_text: Our family was in the city for a funeral, and I needed to book some last minute accommodations. We were a little concerned about the coronavirus and what it was going to be like once we got there, but the gentleman who greeted us, John L., made us feel so welcomed, safe, and comfortable from the beginning. He made sure check-in was a breeze, and gave us some really good tips for the city. He truly helped alleviate what was a rather anxious and stressful situation, and really was a lifesaver!  We definitely recommend this place to all of our friends and family!

review_text: Can't recommend enough - this hotel has everythig you need and more. Since a holiday in Manhattan is so on the go, all we needed was a good base to sleep and have breakfast, and this was perfect. The rooms were loevly and clean, the staff were so kind and breakfast was lovely. There was so many choices; they even had coffee and hot chocolate, as well as boiling water for tea. Such a clean and impressive hotel with a nice reception area to chill and and a lovely dining room. Such a calm vibe in the middle of a hustle and bustle city. Love it!

review_text: Stayed for 5 nights at the start of June on the top floor. Great outside terrace was perfect on a warm evening. Ordered Italian food delivery and bought some bottles of wine to enjoy on the terrace. Rooms are a decent size for NY and have a small kitchen and fridge. Also did room service one evening and food was tasty - portions so big I could not finish it. Breakfast very limited due to COVID and a couple of times had to ask for  it to be refilled. Close to Penn Station.

review_text: The slow internet speed caused me not to be able to conduct my business. It was a miracle!  I was back in business again.  This is the kind of employee that  Christopher Nassetta the Hilton CEO and the rest of the Hilton leadership would be proud of every single day

Hotel was spotlessly clean, lifts etc very quick and well organised.   No issues with deposit paid it was back in account before we arrived home.   All in all would def recommend and would return. Location was great.

review_text: Beautiful modern hotel. Stayed for 5 nights. Booked through BA as package which was great value for money. Myself and husband stayed  (late 40s).  Hotel is located very close to Times Square.   But didn't hear too much noise. We were on 11th floor overlooking the market area. Room was plenty big enough for us and bonus with no charge for safe. Bed was large and comfy, TV was fine although a radio /music station would have suited us more. Shower was powerful and I can see how the bathroom wall could be an issue if staying with friends.  Breakfast was included and we definitely didn't starve! From fruit, yoghurt, bread, pastries, pancakes, waffles, hot food as well as juice, tea & coffee. We didn't have to que at all but our body clocks were very mixed up and we were down there when it opened.   We ate in hotel restaurant, which we felt was decent value for money. Happy hour between 5-9pm was a bonus (wine and cocktails). We also had a drink in the attached cafe before we came home which was fine.   Would highly recommend and would def stay there again. â€¦

review_text: Stayed for four nights to celebrate 30th birthday. Location was brilliant, very close to main Times Square attractions and close to lots of subway lines to explore the whole city. The hotel itself was clean and rooms were a reasonable size and had all amenities.  Some room for improvement in our opinion, breakfast was very busy, had to queue to get in any time after 8.30am and it crossed where the elevators were so it was mayhem at times. Breakfast was good variety but not big enough area for number of people, it was a shame it let the hotel down.  We also had issues with the service, front of house staff didn't know how to help at times or didn't want to help which we haven't had in USA before as they're usually very welcoming people. Final comments were having tea/coffee available to residents, paying a lot of money to stay but there were no facilities and we had to buy one from the cafe. We also had to pay an extra $21 per night for room cleaning, again for the price why is this not included, or optional, I didn't need room cleaning for a 4 night stay and would rather not pay extra if I had the choice. Hotel has a lot of potential and I would return but wanted to feedback on a few little things that could make it a great place! â€¦

review_text: Picked this hotel mainly for it's close location to the theaters - great being able to just walk to and from. Rooms were clean. A little on the small size, but I find that quite normal for NYC. Only bad part for us was the free breakfast buffet. Have seen some other reviews stating the food was great - it was not. My daughter quoted that the coffee was the worst coffee she had ever had. The rest of the breakfast buffet was just not good quality to me. We ended up getting breakfast from a few nearby placed during the rest of our stay.

review_text: The hotel was in a amazing location in time square. The hotel accommodated our special requests as it was my husbands surprise 40th birthday. They upgraded us to the 25th floor with a balcony and it was amazing!  The breakfast was brilliant! All you can eat English/American breakfast and unlimited drinks of tea and coffee and juices!  We would definitely stay again and thank you again Riu Plaza!  Kind regards Ami & Matt from the uk

review_text: Great location, just round the corner from Times Square and all the theatres.  Check in and check our was easy. The held a deposit for damages on my credit card which was cancelled on departure. The rooms are quite small, but as a base it was fine. We are not the type to spend much time in the room so it was fine for us. The rooms were clean and the maid visited every day. The breakfast was great with lots to choose from. We ate in the fashion restaurant each morning instead of the main restaurant as it was smaller with the same food available. The only downside I had, was one morning we had to be out for a tour by 630am meaning we would miss breakfast. The hotel wouldnâ€™t provide us with any breakfast when I enquired. I requested just bakery items like croissants but they wouldnâ€™t help.â€¦

review_text: Perfect location for any first timers as the hotel is only a block away from Times Square so it's very easy to find. We arrived at the hotel at 2pm and had to pay a $20 fee to check in early, although we were upgraded to a balcony room, which was absolutely amazing. The rooms were clean and modern. My birthday fell on the second day of the trip, I had a happy birthday note and a box of chocolates, it was a lovely touch! Breakfast was a little chaotic due to a member of staff having to check everyone's vaccination status before entering, I'd recommend getting there before 9.30am, otherwise you queue all through the lobby. The breakfast was buffet style and had something for everyone. Everyone was asked to wear masks in the hotel and if you were unvaccinated you had to eat yourâ€¦

review_text: Just come back from 5 days in New York.  This was our first visit and hotel was in a great location short walk to times square.   We where given a room on 16th floor room well sized clean and modern, and bed was comfortable which is always a bonus.   The room was cleaned daily.  My only grip was occasionally it took a while for the shower to get hot water sometimes it was fine others it just took a while.  Breakfast was included for our stay limited choice but selection was OK.  The staff where all very friendly and throughly enjoyed our stay.

review_text: A great place at a great price.  As noted by others, the room was small and could be a negative if you plan to relax much in the room, but everything inside is very efficiently organized.  Shower is large with two choices of faucets, good towels, flat screen TV, mini-fridge, and reasonable views.  Fast elevators and very friendly people at the  front desk and throughout.  Breakfast was an unexpected pleasure and bargain (noting that it is a buffet).  Times Square location exactly and convenient to several subway stops.  Best recommendation -- we will return.

review_text: My friend had theater tickets to see "The Music Man" for an evening performance so we decided to go into the city early, sight see, go to the play and stay over before trekking back to Jersey.  I researched many hotels and Riu Times Square was best location and price.  We arrived early (noon) hoping to just drop our bags and head out but due to the polite, professional and courteous staff members Yanet and John; we were able to check in early!  Check in was quick and efficient and their advice where to eat and what to see was spot on!  Friendly smiles and neat appearance and this duo was better than Batman and Robin!!!  Kudos for hiring such caring and competent people - will definitely stay there again and recommend to everyone we know - room was small but perfect forâ€¦

review_text: We had an absolutely amazing time staying at this hotel for our 4 night New York getaway. When we arrived, we were checked in by John who was extremely helpful and very accommodating. He gave us complimentary early check-in (as we arrived way before the checkin time) & allocated us a room on the 23rd floor with amazing views of Times Square. The rooms itself was very comfortable and spotless. It was on the smaller side, typical for New York but was more than enough room for 2 people and 3 suitcases. The maids service was particularly good as well, rooms were tidied and beds made every day. Fresh towels were also available on request. Breakfast was a typical buffet style with array of choices from sausages, eggs, bacon to fresh fruits and continental items. Overall, we had anâ€¦

review_text: We had a fantastic 5 nights here. The room was clean and had everything you would need, housekeeping would clean it every day if you wanted them to. The hotel is modern with friendly helpful staff. As for people complaining about queues at breakfastâ€¦if you go down for breakfast in a hotel this size itâ€™s always going to be busy. We were usually down at 7am (wanting to make the most of our time in New York) and there were no queues. The breakfast selection is excellent you are spoilt for choice and over the course of a week can be quite a big saving if youâ€™re on a budget. Weâ€™ll definitely coming back to New York and this will be the first hotel we check prices for. Itâ€™s in a great location 5 mins from Times Square and a 20 min walk from Central Park.

review_text: Me and my sister stayed here for 5 nights and we honestly couldnâ€™t fault anything at all. We were greeted upon arrival & we were told we were being upgraded to a bigger room. One of the staff took our suitcases up to our room for us, which was absolutely brilliant service. This hotel was also very central to a lot of attractions. Breakfast was a little busy & chaotic but itâ€™s not really their fault, as everyone had to show their covid passes (NYC rules). If I ever come to New York again then I would definitely consider staying here again. Also, we were on floor 11 & even there the views were amazing.

review_text: We booked a family room for five the room had two bedrooms, one with a king size bed and another with two double beds. There was a large shower and two sinks in the bathroom that was separate from the bedrooms and a separate toilet from the bathroom. The room also had a small fridge which was great for storing drinks. There were large wardrobes in both rooms and the room was very clean. The air conditioning was good. Large windows in each room with great views over the city. Breakfast was great with a wide selection from pastries, cereals, cooked breakfast, pancakes and waffles. The queue for breakfast can put some people off but the queue moves quickly and is well organised. The hotel is a short 5 minute walk from time square and in a great location for all the attractions. Theâ€¦

Our bags were lost by the airline and we had to queue in the long line every day to check if they had arrived; surely the hotel could have emailed us/rang the from? Each time this was a saga, one day there were bags that could have been ours but wouldnâ€™t check until the manager had finished interviewing?! (We couldnâ€™t hang around as had theatre tickets booked) bags came on our last full day no one bothered to ring the room in the morning we only got them by queuing for reception again. review_text: Customer Care non existing! We booked our holiday with a travel agent here in Ireland.  We paid for everything in advance including our hotel room.  Arrived at this hotel after a 10 hours journey, to find out our hotel didn't have a reservation for us, even though I had our reservation number, voucher and all other information needed.  We were told to sit and they would try figure it out.  40 minutes passed and noone came to us, bare in mind we had our 2 kids sitting in a lobby, tired after travelling, we go back up to the reception and the guy told me 'I forgot to ring reservations!!' so I asked him to ring, he tells me they close at 6.15pm, it was 6.20pm.  I asked 'what am I do to? we've just arrived after our journey, we have a booking, what am I to do?' He shrugs heâ€¦

review_text: We stayed here in February for a short break.  Rooms were the usual small NYC type, but were clean and very comfortable.  The bed was one of the best I've slept in and room service/cleaning was second to none. The restaurant and cafe were all very good. Check in was easy. I'd recommend and definitely stay again.

review_text: Pros:  Great Location. Easy access to Times Square, Broadway, metro and walking to other neighborhoods. Breakfast included. It was standard continental, hot foods, cereal, fruits, yogurt, breads. Something for everyone. Also had a boxed breakfast which some of our late sleepers took advantage of. It was good- croissant, fruit cup, yogurt. Another box had meat/eggs (I think). Staff did a good job of managing the lines and keeping them out of the way of the elevators. I think this was a problem mentioned in other reviews- so they took note and have made a solution. Clean room. Wood(or fake wood) floors, so it's cleaner overall versus carpet. There were extra towels /well stocked for the entire family from Day#1. Had enough bed space for our family of 5 with teens. Bed was comfyâ€¦

review_text: We were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. We are a family of 5 and it is pretty difficult to find hotels offering accommodations in one room. The room was great, modern, clean, and comfy. The customer service was excellent! Every employee we had contact with was friendly, polite and helpful. The premises are nice, and the location is excellent! We celebrate our sonâ€™t 14th birthday and after a great 3 day stay, we came back to our room to a card and a box of chocolates for him! I also used the gym (that is open 24/7) and the equipment was well maintained and clean. Our breakfast was included and the dinning room was very well organized and with a great selection of foods. I would recommend this hotel for anyone visiting the city and families with kids.  Thanks RIU for thisâ€¦

review_text: We arrived on 12th Feb after an 8 hour flint from London and greeted by welcoming check in staff. Check in was an easy process and we were then given the keys to our room on the 14th floor which had amazing views facing towards Times Sauare. The room itself was clean with a thoroughly comfortable King Size bed. The bathroom was very clean and the shower was refreshing and always warm. Although there were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room this wasnâ€™t an issue as there was an affordable cafe on site. Breakfast was part of the package and every morning there was more than ample choice both hot and cold and very very filling. Plenty of seating and in Covid times it was well organised in the waiting process to access the dining area.  The rooms were cleaned daily andâ€¦

review_text: My husband booked this hotel for my mum and myself based on good reviews and it did not disappoint. Very central location with everything you need within walking distance. Check-in was quick, $21 pn to be paid for hotel facilities. The room key is needed to access the lifts which was a nice added security measure. Breakfast served from 7-10am which was plentiful and varied. Could have been warmer but I understand this us difficult with a buffet. Seating is quite crammed in the restaurant with us having to move our chairs mid meals to let people into their table. Rooms were bright, beds and pillows extremely comfortable. Only thing I feel I need to mention is that the wall between the shower and the room is frosted glass which means if you turn the light on through the night itâ€¦

review_text: I've stayed at other RIU's and was excited to stay here with my small family group.  The lobby looks great and is a nice first impression. My check in process was fast and efficient (I checked in online before arriving). The rest of my party took awhile to get set up.  We all received early check-in, which was appreciated after a redeye flight.  The 8th floor looked like a hospital hallway.  Room 822 was very small. My pet peeve is cleanliness (or lack up). I found hairs everywhere and asked for a new room.  The new room was better, bigger. Again, cleanliness. My daughter and I prepare for bed and I see specks of BLOOD stains on the inside of the sheets. My husband called down and someone promptly changed the linen.

review_text: Beautiful lobby decor, well located for theatre and restaurants. Reception efficient and friendly.  Extraordinary breakfast buffet.  The room size is small, but well designed.  Entire staff courteous and well trained.  Good value.

Wouldnâ€™t put me off staying again. Amazing value and would be back to stay in the future.

review_text: Arrived late evening after long flight to be told room not available and here is $25 to get a taxi to alternative hotel. Excuse about flood on floor - not true constantly changing story. Asked to speak to a manager told we are all managers on that shift! Having been a hotel manager this was just ridiculous. Very unhelpful staff. Returned the following morning after making our feelings known we were refunded  resort fee and after  insisting to speak to a manager about the situation we were given access to executive lounge as a GOGW. Absolute waste if time. We had originally booked room that gave us access but it is a waste of money. Hot drinks machine cans of soda crisps and peanuts is all you get. Breakfast was an absolutely manic crammed like sardines into a restaurant that wasâ€¦

review_text: I have just returned from a 5 night stay here and It was great. Fab locations, great breakfast buffet with a huge selection! room was a good size for 2, massive bed and we had a good view. Easy check in and very friendly helpful staff. There are reviews about door keys not working and it being dirty but we didn't experience this at all. We had to pay extra for the faculty fees but we expected this so it was fine :) would deffo stay again

review_text: Spent two nights in this hotel recovering from a funeral (not mine). My wife insisted that breakfast should be included and the Riu Plaza Times Square was picked at random from the list Expedia threw up. Great choice. The place is busy but very quite away from the lobby area. The corridors are very much like those on a cruise liner with simple white walls and a wood-effect floor covering. Our room was similar but very comfortable. The bathroom was very nice and had space to put stuff, something I find lacking in many hotels. He and She can lay all their accoutrements out with annoying to other.  We had a spectacular view to the south and west from our 19th floor room. I expect the higher floors have even better views. Breakfast is substantial but queuing is inevitable because ofâ€¦

review_text: Great location for a broadway show.  It is just a 5 -7 minute walk to the theatre and Times Square.  Check in was quick even though we were 2 hours early. review_text: Stayed here for 3 days during a visit to NYC. This was my 9th visit to NYC but first time staying at this hotel.  First impressions of hotel were good, very nice modern lobby area with a nice bar in the lobby area also. Location is excellent as very close to Times Square. However, once we exited the elevator on our floor the hotel decor had a very clinical feel about it, especially the hallways.   Bedroom was decent size compared to other NYC hotels Iâ€™ve stayed in and quite modern but again had a clinical feel about it. Beds moved around floor quite easily when getting into the bed or moving around. Other than that, beds were very comfortable.   I was very surprised that there was no tea/coffee facilities in the room. This is the first hotel that I have ever stayed in that didâ€¦

review_text: We stayed there from 1st Feb to 6th Feb 2022 - loved the hotel and the staff were all amazing and so helpful.  Shout out to Kenneth and his team at the restaurant bar - remember the pink ladies :) and breakfast Olanda and all the team there were really friendly too.  My only constructive comments would be for the hotel to provide say one or two pages of paper with opening times on it for breakfast, pointing guests to their restaurant, explaining more about the internet, and perhaps a local map pointing out some places to see. Yes I know they provide the typical Rui magazine, but something more personal would be great.  Apart from that, the hotel was clean, tidy and the overall impression would mean we would return there and be guests at the hotel. Thank you Kenny - I hope you doâ€¦

review_text: I went to NYC for the first time to celebrate my birthday. Having stayed at other Riu hotels undecided to stay at the Riu Plaza Manhattan but since the hotel has not been opened I was bumped to the Riu Plaza New York Times Square. Since the moment I arrived I was provided with great customer service (kudos to Lori Anne in customer service). Even though I arrived before 4 pm my room was ready and they gave me the keys right away. The room was small but super clean and with  great view from the 23rd floor. My breakfast was included and I've got to say, the continental breakfast was really good. Plenty of food for all tastes. If you are fully vaccinated you can eat at the restaurant and if you are not you can request it to be boxed and then you pick it up. The only thing I wouldâ€¦

review_text: Perfect location for exploring NYC!  The Lobby is modern and bright, the Lobby Cafe is convenient for grabbing a coffee as you head out to explore (though service is slow) and rooms are a decent size for New York.  I found the service overall good, and our rooms clean (was travelling with friends).   The hotel offers a complimentary breakfast buffet, but we opted to skip breakfast and head out.

review_text: The hotel is located a block from time square in the heart of the theater district. This is why we booked it. The location is perfect. The hotel itself is nice. It is very European. The price point is also very cheap for NYC which made it appealing. I thought the hotel was a big dated. The bed linens and pillows in particular were in need of a refresh. I also thought the room could have been cleaner. The staff seems friendly and the bar is nice, but closes fairly early for New York standards. Over all the hotel was fine. Not the best and not the worst. It is certainly worth the price.

review_text: My check in experience was amazing.  I arrived at 10 and my room was not ready.  I was told I would get an email when it was.  I went to two meetings and came back at 12:15.  At 12:25 Janice saw me sitting in the lobby and came over to tell me my room was ready.  She had sent the email at 12:22 and then saw me sitting there.  She came over in case I did not check my emails all the time.  I was very impressed.

review_text: We arrived on my daughterâ€™s birthday. The staff were really welcoming and acknowledged her birthday. Our request for a higher floor could not be accommodated on the first night but they did move us to floor 24 on our 2nd night. The rooms are lovely, spacious, clean and views are great. The location if perfect for Broadway, Times Square and the subway. Breakfast was excellent, there is a great variety to choose from. I would definitely stay here again.

review_text: This hotel is situated a couple of minutes walk from Times Square and ideally located to get to theatres and attractions.  The breakfast buffet is plentiful, proof of vaccination and photo ID is required to enter.  Shuttle bus from hotel to airport is a reasonable $35pp and was a comfortable and no hassle option.  Reception were helpful - unfortunately tho,  Iâ€™d emailed ahead of time to advise of my friends birthday and asking if they could do something special for her arrival and this request was ignored!   Rooms were very clean and modern, nice toiletries and excellent maid service - be aware that there are no tea/coffee making facilities in the room but the bar downstairs does offer tea/coffee in Tahoe out cups so you can take it to your room.  The rooms were quite cold andâ€¦

review_text: I enjoyed my stay (3 nights) at Hotel Riu, which is located between restaurant row and 3 theaters (including Richard Rogers, where Hamilton is playing).  It's 4 blocks from the Port Authority, from which you can get anywhere.  The morning buffet breakfast is excellent.  There was a slight misunderstanding about my booking, and they corrected it immediately.  I would definitely stay there again when I return!

review_text: We arrived at the Riu Plaza after a delayed flight with a child in tow that had been really travel sick, about 2am in the morning, our time, to be told at reception that there had been a 'water leak' at the hotel and that our rooms were unavailable!!!!!!   There clearly hadn't been a water leak, they had just overbooked due to potential covid cancellations. Our rooms would apparently be ready the next morning, but in the meantime we would have to get a taxi to another hotel, the M Social, which I have to say was a better hotel. The following morning we had to get a taxi back to the Riu as our rooms would be ready, this then ate into the plans we had for our first day in New York and really tainted the experience.   The hotel could not accommodate either of our requests, 2 singleâ€¦

review_text: From the time that I entered the doors everyone was polite and accommodating. My wife and I were early for check in and the bell hop took our bags for holding, went to the front desk and helped by a gentleman named John who was by far the best, he worked in such a professional way. He was clear in his information and was able to confirm all of our questions. He is an asset to hotel. Not to mention that he was able to get our room so that we could enjoy the rest of afternoon without any back and forth. Thanks John.

review_text: We booked a room with them on expedia and we had multiple things broken inside the room. They upgraded our room . As we are settling in , we turned on the jacuzzi and black mold pieces started rushing out of it which was nasty. The maintenance guy said he will let the manager know and so far we have heard back. Please avoid this hotel if you want a clean and hygiene hotel room

review_text: I stayed at RIU Plaza because I needed to a mini getaway from my family during the holiday season. This hotel was everything I was looking for, from the cleverly designed room to the convenient location to the remarkably NICE staff. Of course, the place was CLEAN. I am hesitant in giving this such a high rating because I wanted to keep this my little secretâ€¦ LOL I will definitely recommend to friends and family visiting NYC.

review_text: The Hotel is in very central location, Metro, Time Square close by. Hotel Staff are friendly, Rooms are modern and clean. Good International Breakfast buffet. I recommend early Breakfast otherwise its quite grouted. In general you need to show your vaccination ID if you want to enter any restaurant for dine inn.

review_text: I have stayed in quite a few riu hotels over the years this is why we picked this hotel, but for me it doesnâ€™t compare to the others  the hotel itâ€™s self is lovely and is possibility the only hotel in New York that breakfast is included although there was a large selection of  food it wasnâ€™t very hot and during the time of Covid when they check your vaccination status throughly every morning  your sat virtually on top of other people which is a bit close  for my liking ,  my other concern on the Covid front is that everyone is required to wear a mask which everyone does without question apart from the people who clean your rooms , we was in a lift then a lady came in with her big trolley and no mask so we got back out of the lift and waited for the next one while we were waitingâ€¦

review_text: This was our first trip to New York and we were very excited to spend Christmas here! Iâ€™m going to start of with the positives. The location of the hotel is excellent and the room was clean with a nice view. We were also offered a late check-out (an extra hour) at no extra charge which was very helpful.  The staff were very kind and polite especially the breakfast team.  Unfortunately we were very disappointed with everything else. The rooms do not come with a duvet but a thin blanket in sheets. As we stayed in December we were extremely cold and sadly the heating system is not great. Took a long time to warm up and still was not quite warm enough. There is very little bathroom privacy as the partition wall as well as the sliding door which do not lock or close properly are madeâ€¦

review_text: Stayed in this hotel with my wife for 10 nights just before Christmas. Very clean hotel. Stylish public areas. Took covid precautions very seriously. Nice room which was modern and well equipped. Perfect location in Manhattan. What made our hotel were the lovely staff throughout the hotel. Particularly the evening staff in the Fashion Restaurant and Bar. We had a lovely waiter from the Dominican Republic who was so friendly and attentive. Sorry I canâ€™t remember your name but thank you for your excellent service and looking after us ! Would definitely return to this brilliant hotel.

review_text: Hotel itself was good we had no issues with the room it was fairly small but we only slept there very clean and bed very comfortable, we were on the 30th floor so separate lifts and no issues with waiting or the room keys. The problem we did have was on arrival for our 4 night stay after a very long day with a 3 and a half hour flight we were told they had no rooms for us and we had to walk down the road in the rain at what was now 4am in the morning to us to the alternative hotel which quite frankly was horrid , we had to troop back in the morning for breakfast and to leave our luggage as they didnâ€™t have a room till late in the day. review_text: Check in took longer than expected because the clerk couldn't find my reservation. We think they gave our room away (hotel was full) and when we showed up, they had to find something for us. We had to quickly sign a document stating we were being "upgraded" to the 26th floor, but there was nothing special about it. Our room keys didn't give us access to the executive lounge and our room was TINY. If that's an executive room, I can't imagine what the regular rooms must be like as it felt like we were sleeping in one of the IKEA room displays. The glass walled shower and bathroom was odd. Not only can you see the outline of whoever is inside the bathroom/shower, there isn't a fan or any real privacy. It took an hour and fifteen minutes for someone to deliver an extra pillow to ourâ€¦

review_text: Very nice hotel overall. Check-In was simple, everyone was super nice and helpful and it is in the perfect location for Midtown stuff and super quick walk to major subway stops. The rooms are small even for NYC standards. The hotel includes breakfast which is great if you can get there at 7am or don't mind waiting forever in line. To their credit, they tell you when the "best" times are to go down but that is just not always conducive. When we did go down for breakfast around 9, there was an enormous line stretching through the lobby so we had to pass.   Overall it was fine, but it was very expensive for what you got and despite being on the 20th floor there was still a great deal of street noise. The Intercontinental a few blocks away where I have usually stayed isâ€¦

review_text: Fabulous location for exploring New York. We enjoyed our morning runs around Central Park which is 0.5 mile away. All the staff were amazing and they have totally nailed the Covid requirements ie mask wearing, checking of vaccination status etc - make sure you download the NYC Covid Safe app as it is accepted here, in restaurants and the theatre. Our room was clean and spacious with two very comfortable beds. Would happily stay here again. Thank you to all the staff for our wonderful stay.

There is also a fridge in the room ,but if you leave a room key in  the slot so the electric can stay on be prepared for it to be taken away by the maid. Rooms were quite dusty ,surfaces arenâ€™t wiped over .Any glasses or cups ,cutlery etc taken to your room will be there for the whole of your stay. review_text: Room was clean, comfortable, and really not too small as others have mentioned. Don't expect a palace and you'll be just fine.   Two things that were really unacceptable: 1. Long wait for luggage storage - I arrived early in the morning before check-in time, so I needed to store a large piece of luggage. Short line at the bellhop desk, but the process somehow took 15 minutes. On my return to the hotel later that same afternoon to check-in and access my room, I waited 20 minutes to collect my luggage and had to give up since I would have run late for an appointment. Claimed my luggage later in the evening. As a result of this experience, I opted to pay for luggage storage elsewhere on my last day in New York prior to an evening flight.   2. Long wait for luggage storage - I arrived early in the morning before check-in time, so I needed to store a large piece of luggage. Short line at the bellhop desk, but the process somehow took 15 minutes. On my return to the hotel later that same afternoon to check-in and access my room, I waited 20 minutes to collect my luggage and had to give up since I would have run late for an appointment. Claimed my luggage later in the evening. As a result of this experience, I opted to pay for luggage storage elsewhere on my last day in New York prior to an evening flight. 2. Long wait for the elevator - My roomâ€¦

review_text: Stayed for a week in November, 2 couples. Excellent location to get around. Rooms really clean and super comfy beds and great shower, rooms not huge but apparently thatâ€™s usually for New York. Breakfast was great, good choice for all tastes, yes it was busy but staff were very efficient and never had to queue for long, really sets you up for the day. Just one slight criticism was that there are no tea/coffee facilities in the rooms so would advise taking a travel kettle, although there is a full size fridge and they give you bottled water daily.  Staff very nice throughout the Hotel, would definitely stay there again.

review_text: We had a lovely corner room with lots of windows for our 9 night stay.  As it was over Thanksgiving the hotel was extremely busy.  To cater for this there were lots and lots of staff everywhere.  They all did so well keeping the checkin / guest services going, the restaurants and even had people in front of the lifts so people could get out and in easily.    Nothing was too much trouble for the staff and the breakfast was just as good as we remembered.  The main restaurant was very busy but had a great buzz about it and we had the grab and go a couple of times too for a quick bite in the bedroom before heading out.   The staff did a great job protecting everyone with vaccine and ID checks at the restaurants and sanitiser everywhere.   I used the gym a couple of times which wasâ€¦

review_text: This hotel is in the perfect location for Times Square and the theatre district.  The views across the city from floor 28 are stunning.  However, it lacks in quite a few areas.  The rooms were clean but had no tea or coffee making facilities and for such a highly rated hotel this was disappointing.  This may not have been an issue were it not for the breakfast situation.  Gasping for tea we eagerly made our way to breakfast on the first morning to find ourselves battling out of the lift as the queue for the restaurant is ridiculously located blocking the lifts.  Patiently joining the end of the queue it seemed to move quickly so my hope of tea wasnâ€™t out of reach (Iâ€™m British and we need tea).  Once inside the restaurant it was time to join the queue for the buffet.  Once youâ€¦

review_text: We only stayed in this hotel for 5 days and in that space we were stuck in an elevator and there was a fire in the hotel.  Worst customer service I have ever experienced in my life! After being stuck in an elevator for over an hour, having to get rescued by the FDNY (who had to get us out from the top of the elevator) not one member of staff was there to ask us even if we were okay or offered us a glass of water!  A few days later at 9pm the fire alarms went off and the hotel evacuated because a member of staff had thrown a cigarette in the large hotel garbage causing a fire. WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE AND WORST HOTEL. Do not waste your money!!!!

review_text: My room was ready 4 hours early.  It was super clean with amazing views.  The staff was all incredibly friendly during my stay. review_text: The location is great if you are looking to sightsee. We like walking so for us it was located in a great spot to see major midtown landmarks. Staff was a mixed bag. Man who was greeting guests and making sure they were in right line was friendly. Beyond that. Not really the friendliness bunch.  Room was average. It was clean but had some flaws. The shower leaked some which created a pretty slippery floor. The grab and go was great for drinks and snacks. Then there were the elevators. Holy moly. Ask for a lower level floor as itâ€™s nearly impossible to catch an elevator in the morning. Many guests, including us were forced to navigate the tight stairwell. Not great when checking out with our luggage. All in all an average stay.

review_text: We stayed during veterans day week just as the US was being opened to international visitors. As such, we saw a large influx of tourists from outside the US and the folks at the RIU handled the increase with professionalism from checkin to the breakfast to room cleanings. Breakfast was buffet and included a large variety of options include eggs (3 variations), sausages, chicken, salmon, veggies, cheeses, oatmeal, fruit juices, coffee/tea, etc. They used both restaurants during breakfast to manage the crowds. We were on the 12th floor and it was super quiet.

review_text: I booked my stay here through a third party and had a horrible experience with the third party. Riu was super helpful and supportive through the chaotic process. Although fully booked, they accommodated me to have a stay at the hotel. I truly enjoyed my stay here. The hotel is beautiful, well maintained and clean. The cafe is a pleasant midday or evening treat although not robust. I did not visit the restaurant, so I am unsure about it. The gym has a decent amount of cardio equipment and free weights. The breakfast each morning is fantastic and fresh each day. I went early to avoid the long waits and would advise the same for others. The staff ran the breakfast process efficiently despite the long lines. My room on the 8th floor was 46th st facing, quiet and clean. Housekeepingâ€¦

review_text: We arrived early at the hotel and was unable to check in so we decided to pre check in and leave our luggage with the bell boy and go out and see the city. On return we went back to the grading desk to collect our room key and were given a room on the 30 floor (top floor) and the gentleman behind the front desk pointed to the 5 lifts. As we entered the lifts/elevators we noticed that floor 30th did not exist! We tracked down another member of staff and he showed us to the lift/elevator on the other side and apologised for the front desk staff for being new and sending us to the wrong elevators. We got to our room and it was very small with one bed, not like the photos on booking.com but it was fine and perfectly adequate for the one night we had booked. We then took a lay downâ€¦

review_text: Our stay at the hotel was really nice. First impression: hotel was clean and tidy and the lobby is simply stunning. Only complaint is it was confusing where the lines begun to check in - they should set up some divider lines so its clear, people were kinda all over the place.  The room was clean and we had great views of the city - didnt hear any neighbors next door. Going to breakfast required showing proof of vaccination, so be sure to bring your card and ID, the food was delicious and we were surprised by the variety of selections to choose from both hot and cold foods. We had drinks in the restaurant below which were great but we had to wait almost a half hour before the waiter took our order after we were seated. The location is probably the most appealing, walking distanceâ€¦

review_text: We picked this hotel for our family NY vacation - two adults and 3 kids - primarily because of location, included breakfast and rooms that were considered to be "family" rooms. We assumed (and it looked like this from the pictures) that they'd be able to comfortably accommodate 5.  Location turned out to be great - under 10 min to Times Square and several options for subway stops within 5-10 min walking time. Lobby was pretty impressive and well kept. Staff was nice and tried to help, but it a number of situations we've ran into very untrained staff. They tried, but they clearly didn't know how to do a number of tasks.  Check in was fairly efficient, but a very unexpected "surprise" was $20 per night "facilities fee". They listed things that were included, but aside fromâ€¦

review_text: We arrived around 11:30 at the hotel, to early to check in so we were able to leave our bags with the bellman. We were told to come back around 3. Our room was on the 26th floor. Great views. The room was clean and comfortable.   We were told the breakfast got really busy  around 8 or 8:30 so we were always downstairs before that. The choices were really good. We always got plenty to eat.   This is our 3rd time staying at this location and we will for sure be back again.   Thanks Riu for a great stay!!

review_text: Booked through Tripadvisor Plus a family room that indicated it had 3 beds and showed pictures matching the description of the family suite on the hotel website. The family suite, has 2 rooms with 2 beds in 1 room and 1 bed in the 2nd room.  During check-in, the receptionist first asked me if I booked a room with 1 bed. After which I indicated that my room was supposed to have 3 beds. The confirmation sent from TripAdvisor had  a room name that had a name different from any on their website, so he refused to honor the reservation. Ended up with a single room with 2 beds and a couch.   After spending nearly 2 hours on the phone with multiple people at TripAdvisor, they would only provide a credit, if I could provide screenshots of the room description. Which I was not able toâ€¦

review_text: There are big pros and big cons to this hotel. Main con - the room was so noisy. I felt I am sleeping on the 8th avenue, The window was ineffective in noise reduction. Noises from the corridor were also disturbing. I believe most of the rooms suffer from this problem. Then check in process was a nightmare. I arrived at 11am. Waited all the line just to learn that check in starts at 4pm and they charge $50 for earlu check in. This is crzy. I understand that you will be charged if you want to pre book an early check in, but when you arrive - if there is no room, it's one thing, but if there is room - why not give the room for free? A week earlier at the Westin I got a room at 6am(and it was a very quiet room)! Then when I told the receptionist the next day that I had a horribleâ€¦

review_text: I booked 3 rooms total. Hotel staff somehow broke the door jam while delivering things to my room while we were out. They did not notify hotel management, and the DOOR WAS LEFT OPEN for anyone to enter for the entire night. Management's response when I reported it was "I don't think anyone entered your room since we have security in the lobby."   My brother's bathroom flooded every time he showered. He threw all 4 of his towels on the floor to soak up the water every day. He also reported the issue 3 days in a row. No one ever came up to attempt a fix, even though they did admit that MOLD was appearing to grow on the floor based on a picture provided by my brother. Liz, the manager,  admitted standard response should have been to move him to another room, then stated they wouldâ€¦

review_text: Location is great. About 1-2 blocks from Times Square area, close access to subways, taxis, etc. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet but there can be a long line in the morning. The only downfall, as others mentioned is the awkward bathroom situation. The â€œwallâ€ between the bathroom and the room is frosted glass right in the shower. You can see an outline of the showering person and there is no soundproofing so you can hear all bathroom sounds. Beds are comfy. Ask for a high floor when reserving. We were on floor 23 and it was quiet.

review_text: I really enjoyed my stay here!!!  I was here from Oct 5 thru Oct 8th.  From the time I checked in until I left, I was so happy that I stayed here.  First, it was safe and clean and the location was PERFECT.  It is literally 1 block from the Theatre District AND from the double-decker tour pick-up bus stop that I went on Top View.  The one thing I will say to new check-ins is that you need to use one of the room's card keys to insert into the lightbox AFTER you enter your hotel room and this will allow the lights to stay on.  Aside from that, I was very happy with my stay here.   I like that you need a card key to use the elevator.   I think this should be a little more clear but I figured it out because I read the comments on this website before I left on my trip.  Theâ€¦

review_text: This hotel is in a good location for access to much of New Yorkâ€™s activities but that is about the only positive thing that i can write.   The rooms are small, spartan, not very clean, lacking in simple things e.g. soap in the shower. The walls are thin and you can hear your neighbors quite clearly. Check-in was ridiculously slow.   The hotel is understaffed, which is not necessarily their fault as many businesses are finding it hard to find staff but some of the simple things that are being missed affect your stay.  Would not stay here again.

review_text: The hotel is very clean!  Our room was small but perfect. The staff were very friendly and helpful.  Housekeeping visited and cleaned our room daily.  The location is perfect.  Close to all the theaters and many restaurants.  Subway close by.  Close but far enough away from Times Square.  Central Park is within walking distance.  Just turn left on 8th and you end up at Columbus Circle and the entrance to Central Park.  The Top View bus stop is right at the corner.  We highly recommend the night tour!!!  We originally planned to stay 5 nights.  Extended our visit two additional nights because we did not want to leave!!!  We are already planning our return to Riu Times Square in the Spring.  We fell in love with NYC and the Riu!!!

review_text: I spent the weekend here to celebrate my wedding anniversary. This hotel is right in the heart of Times Square. The staff was very friendly. The room very comfortable. The bathroom is a bit see through with glass doors.  The buffet breakfast was delicious and you do have many options. It does get very busy the later you show up for breakfast. I would be nice if the had a separate entrance to the breakfast restaurant as it is right by the elevators and it gets quite crowded. Overall this was a great property snd would definitely stay here again.

review_text: This hotel is just a block away from the heart of Times Square so it is easy to walk everywhere, including Times Square and Central Park. Many subway stations are nearby so no matter which direction you walk, you can also take the subway easily. The hotel offers breakfast but you have to eat in breakfast room and can not take food to your room, which was disappointing, especially since the room gets crowded and social distancing is impossible. The room was nice size and comfortable. Your bags can be stored before/after check in. There is a restaurant onsite. I felt that I definitely got my moneyâ€™s worth with my stay! I highly recommend this hotel.

review_text: We booked a 3 night junior suite stay.  The hotel has a lovely first impression.  Rooms are small but to expected for a major city.  The hotel is modern and very clean.  HOWEVER, the introduction of free breakfast is a COVID risk and should be avoided at all costs!!!  People are jammed in like sardines and other gusts will queue next to your table without wearing a mask.  To be honest, RIU should be ashamed of this overcrowded practice and apply common-sense during the pandemic!!!  I would not be surprised if their breakfast restaurant wasnâ€™t the source of a C19 outbreak.  AVOID AT ALL COST!!!  I donâ€™t know how they get away with this overcrowding?  Is there not a city hotel ordinance on this?  Would I stay here again? Hard question to answer.  Hotel is lovely and well located. â€¦

review_text: The staff is what ruined my stay at this hotel.  My family stayed 5 nights and I can honestly say each encounter we had with the staff was not pleasant.  They made us feel not welcomed or wanted.  I thought maybe the first encounter was just someone having a bad day, but when it kept happening I came to the conclusion that they lacked customer service.   In addition if you need to call the front desk they do not answer.  You have to travel to the lobby each time to speak with someone.  And the breakfast was absolutely horrible.  Out of the the 5 days we only ate there once.  And that was one of the main attractions for this hotel.  If you are traveling to NY and would like a pleasant experience during your stay I would say research around the area and check the reviews.  I saw aâ€¦

review_text: We enjoyed the recent stay at Riu. The hotel is perfect to check out placed in Manhattan. Most of the tourist attractcions are in walkable distance - one block to Time Square, few minutes to Central Park, many restaurants, hop on hop off bus is right in front of the hotel. The staff were very friendly, and the place was clean - we loved the breakfast buffet! We surely look Riu up next time!

review_text: Pros; The location can't be beat, near Times Square and Restaurant Row. Hotel was very clean and staff was friendly and accommodating. Breakfast had a very wide selection of options and was quite good. There was a small gym that looked nice but we didn't have time to use.  Cons: Although there was signage about social distancing, the line to breakfast and  at the buffet was not socially distant. Also everybody was touching the same utensils in the buffet.  The room was lacking things I've come to take  for granted like a clock and a coffee maker (or at least a coffee stand  in the lobby) The rooms are small if you have more than one person and there is no dresser or  surface to place clothing other than a small desk area.

review_text: I stayed at Hotel Riu from 7/18-7/25.  The first morning I woke up to find a bug in my room. I took pictures of the bug and captured it. It looks just like a bed bug. I call down to the front office (very rude) and say they will send someone up. I go down to complain and again they are just generally rude even before I mention the bug. In the meantime someone took the bug so they can analyze what it is.  They say they will call pest control and are rude during the entire encounter. The next day, 30ish hours later, pest control comes. The front office says they confirmed there is "activity" meaning there are bugs BUT they will not tell me what kind of bug. "We do not release this info to customers" is what I am told.  So here I am with an obvious bed bug sighting and a hotel thatâ€¦

review_text: The hotel is nice and clean, the pre-COVID breakfast is back. Having breakfast at the hotel takes the guess work out of deciding where to go. Our maintenance item was fixed quickly and fresh towels were delivered upon our request. The only issue with the room is that the bathroom has a frosted wall and you can see silhouettes taking a shower if you leave the bathroom light room light on, we figured out that if you turn the bathroom light off and the bed light on you donâ€™t see the silhouettes. Would stay here again.

review_text: Quick check in friendly staff.  Wake up sooner the better to access elevators gym showers & Buffett less people early morning. I say gym showers cause the showers in room are a silhouette you can see your shadow so if you want privacy best to use them.  I had to turn the lights off in room to shower though the shower head was great shampoo body wash smelled good.  The power is turned on with your room key left inserted.  The free breakfast Buffett I did not like only went once best thing I ate was the fresh fruit.  Eggs were runny watery bacon not cooked thoroughly left greasy labeled pinto beans tasted like something else turn off for me.  They do have a small cafe attached to the side of hotel very pricey!   Small refrigerator in room no microwave.

review_text: The hotel is beautiful and in a good location.  Thatâ€™s about all it has going for it.   You have to specifically request for your room to be cleaned. We did 3 days with nothing. We ran out of towels. When we asked the first housekeeper, she told us no. Finally, we saw another housekeeper who gave us some. We ran out of towels and toilet paper because our room was never cleaned and had to call down to get them.   The Fashion Restaurant for dinner is the pits. Their menu is very limited. We got a pasta with pesto and it was greasy and just bad. Next to our table was a TV. That was also where the staff had plugged in their cell phones. Every few minutes, someone would come to check their phone! They were very slow so apparently they had nothing to do.   They have a nice patio area.â€¦

review_text: Our stay was 5 nights on 15th floor.  Hotel and room was spotless.  Just steps from Times Square.  Tons of restaurants in walking distance.  Staff was helpful and friendly.   Asked for two things and they were delivered within minutes.  Breakfast was in boxes due to covid but was just fine.  Eggs, pancake, sausage, bacon and hash browns with juice/coffee and you could add cereal, fruit or yogurt.  Dunkin Donuts is also across the street.  Room cleaning is only upon request.  Lobby and seating area was always clean.   Masks required in hotel and most inside spots.   A few great restaurants we visited in walking distance:  Mercury Bar, Meatball, Pint Bar.   So many things to do but my favorite was Top of the Rock.  Beautiful view of the city.   Next visit I will book it forâ€¦

review_text: Spent the weekend at RIU for our first trip out of town since COVID. The hotel had proper signage for COVID safety precautions and the staff wore mask. I only talked to the check in receptionist and the cleaning woman and they were both very friendly.  I love this hotel because of the proximity to Times Square, Riu is only one block away. I've stayed at the Riu 3 times since it first opened. When it first opened of course the rooms were in better shape but they are still nice and clean now. Depending on the room you may have great view of the city. The only minor issue with the room is there was some noticeable water damage above the closet (picture attached) and some of the furniture was starting to wear but it was nothing too bad. I would definitely stay there again.

new_text: Spent the weekend at RIU for our first trip out of town since COVID. The hotel had proper signage for COVID safety precautions and the staff wore mask. I only talked to the check in receptionist and the cleaning woman and they were both very friendly. I love this hotel because of the proximity to Times Square, Riu is only one block away. I've stayed at the Riu 3 times since it first opened. When it first opened of course the rooms were in better shape but they are still nice and clean now. Depending on the room you may have great view of the city. The only minor issue with the room is there was some noticeable water damage above the closet (picture attached) and some of the furniture was starting to wear but it was nothing too bad. I would definitely stay there again.

review_text: When we arrived at the RIU check in was fast and easy. Even though we arrived early, our room was available. The room was also clean and up to par. Hotel employees were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast included was in a box. Fast elevators and the hotel overall was kept clean and safe. Everything we needed was within walking distance including the subway. We will definitely stay here again.

review_text: Place was clean.  Staff were kind and courteous. Rooms well modern and comfortable. Overall a very pleasant experience and I will definitely stay there again if I'm in town.   The breakfast was delicious, wifi was fast.  Only thing is the TV's can be upgraded so we can use our apps.

review_text: Good location and decent room. They claim that due to COVID, they will not clean the room every dat but we stayed for 4 nights and our room was only cleaned on the first night. They offer free breakfast but they closed the service before the limit time even though we were making a line for more than 30 minutes. I read decent reviews before staying there so I was surprise of our bad experience. My recommendation, go to ANY other hotel, not the RIU Plaza Times Square.
